The two-day summit will begin with a panel discussion on “As a Startup, would you make a Ford or a Ferrari?”, with three speakers, i.e, Ravi Ranjan, a startup expert, KredX India Marketing head Madhusmita Panda and Mobycy CEO Akash Gupta.

A thought leader and startup advisor, Samir Singh Shekhawat, will be speaking on, “Life & Leadership: Lessons from Corporate and Sports Worlds”.

On day two, a national-level case study challenge, ‘Scale It Up’ and a national-level pitching competition ‘iPitch’ would be held followed by the closing ceremony.

Title: Robbers kill youth, injure father, loot Rs 6L
Article:
A youth was killed and his father critically injured when three armed miscreants attacked them and looted cash of Rs 6 lakh from them at Borguda village in Junagarh of Kalahandi district on Thursday evening.

The deceased was identified as Balabhadra Nayak.

Balabhadra and his father Kheti Nayak were returning to their house after withdrawing Rs 6 lakh from a private bank at Bhawanipatna. Midway, three bike-borne miscreants came by a bike and intercepted them near a forest at Borguda. They attacked the duo with an iron rod injuring both critically. The hooligans also allegedly opened fire during the confrontation before decamping with the cash.

Soon after, the father and son were rescued and admitted to the Junagarh Community Health Centre before being shifted to the Burla hospital after their conditions deteriorated. Later, the son succumbed died. Meanwhile, a case in connection with the incident has been registered at the Junagarh police station. Police have seized a gun from the spot and launched a manhunt to nab the culprits.

Title: ‘Cong opposing CAA to defame Modi’
Article:
The Brahmapur district unit of BJP organised an impressive rally led by its Ganjam district president Bibhuti Jena here on Friday to counter the anti-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and NRC protests.

Union Minister Babul Supriyo and BJP national vice-president Baijayant Panda joined the march in support of the CAA. The march commenced from Kamapalli Square and proceeded through the city’s major areas culminating at Ramalingam Tank Road, where a public meeting was held to sensitise the public and dispel their doubts on NRC, NPR and CAA.

Panda said that the CAA was proposed by the then Congress Government at the Centre headed by Manmohan Singh and the same Congress is now opposing the legislation made by the BJP Government in the national interest. He alleged that the Congress is doing sol to defame PM Modi.

Supriyo said the CAA is about giving rights to the persecuted minorities from neighbouring countries and not meant to snatch anybody's rights.

Among others, who joined the rally included former BJP district president Kanhu Charan Pati, Bhrugu Buxipatra, Pinki Pradhan, Gokulananda Mallick and Manini Devi.

Title: MP Tourism Board participates in SATTE 2020
Article:
Being one of the economically rising States of incredible India, Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board participated in SATTE 2020 to educate and highlight growth in the tourism sector held at India Expo Mart, Greater Noida, Delhi–NCR from January 8 to 10.

This year, the exhibition has witnessed a tremendous response from the industry with participation from over 1,000 exhibitors and representation from over 50 countries and cities from across India.

The three-day expo witnessed several exciting partnerships and announcements that promised to predict in new trends of the industry. It provided a platform for all stakeholders in the tourism and hospitality industries to interact and transact business opportunities.

On the occasion, Faiz Ahmed Kidwai, Secretary Tourism, Govt of Madhya Pradesh and Managing Director, Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board said, “Madhya Pradesh is among the most exciting tourist destination in the country and has immense potential for the growth of inbound tourism. We are creating new opportunities and initiatives to promote the state and its rich cultural, natural and architectural heritage and its traditions and history. This year MP has bagged an excellent response with market leaders increasing their stall size with information driven approach for attendees. Globally, travel trade fairs are considered important annual opportunities for face-to-face meetings and networking among buyers and sellers.”

The exhibition saw top-notch, industry influencers, travel enthusiasts, corporate, business heads, travel operators and media professionals from different corners of the country, which came to visit MP stall, exchanging views and opinions on newly developed facilities & services by Madhya Pradesh Tourism.

The Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board has recently won 10 National Tourism Awards and the state has also been listed among the top 3 ‘Best Value Destination’ of the world by Lonely planet- Travel guide book. Madhya Pradesh Government has identified tourism as one of the leading sectors for developments and aims to promote MP as an attractive destination for both domestic and international travellers.

There is a sustained focus on infrastructure development, restoration of heritage sites, development of natural reserves and biodiversity, promotion of sustainable and responsible tourism as well as rural tourism.

The forthcoming major exhibitions in which the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board will be participating to continue with trade networking are the OTM Mumbai, BTM Siliguri, ITM Ahmedabad with an objective to provide a platform for interaction with domestic and international buyers. Besides, ‘Madhya Pradesh Travel Mart (MPTM)’, ‘Mandu Utsav’ and ‘Jal Mahotsav’ are annual events which are very popular amongst the trade people and tourists respective.

Title: E-governance system implemented in 2019 to strengthen traffic and transportation
Article:
The State Government implemented e-governance system in the year 2019 to strengthen the traffic and transportation system in the State for public utility. This has led to reduction in road accidents, control on illegal transport and a big change in the functioning of the Transport Department has seen a big change. The State was awarded with Skoch award at the national level for this innovation.

The State Government also increased revenue by tightening the functioning of the transport department. This resulted in a nearly 8 percent increase in transportation revenue collection last year. Revenue of `1,782 crore was received till November in the year 2018-19 and `1,918.14 crore transportation revenue was collected till November in the year 2019-20. For the recovery of outstanding revenue, transport vehicles used for above 5 years and below 50 years were exempted in a systematic manner.

Free driving licence for women and college girls

According to the manifesto, 65 thousand free driving licenses were distributed to college going girls in the last one year. The new website of the Transport department, htpp: //www.transport.mp.gov.in was launched and made live in June 2019, in accordance with the disabled welfare standards. One lakh 11 thousand 898 learning licenses were issued to women, which was 15 percent more than the licenses issued last year. Decision was taken to organize free quarterly camps of a fixed duration till one year for women on November 19, 2019, the birth anniversary of the country’s first woman Prime Minister Late Indira Gandhi observed as Priyadarshini Day and its implementation was started.

It was decided to set up an automated driving testing track on PPP mode in the state. It was started as a project. For its operation, work was started on the project by appointing CIRT as technical consultant.

Initially, PPP Mode Automated Fitness and Certification Centres are being established in 10 divisional transport offices.

After issuing permits to ensure smooth and efficient public transport system, the distance counter signature has been increased from 25 km to 250 km by the RTO.

GPS based vehicle tracking system has been made mandatory in public transport and commercial vehicles.

A Control and Command Centre is being established for its monitoring. It was decided to implement integrated web application system in the State for PUC centre. For this, the presentation of those institutions will be tested and further action will be taken after studying the system in other states.

Aggregator policy was issued to rent out maxi-cabs, motor cabs, auto-rickshaws and motorcycles in the state. With a view to ensuring safe transportation for students, Control and Regulation Scheme-2019 for educational vehicles has beenlaunched.

Title: Hriday Drishyam to be held from January 11 to 12
Article:
Hriday Drishyam — the Great International yearly musical festival’s 4th edition — will be organised in association with Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board and Cultural Department in Bhopal on January 11 and 12 to preserve, popularise and present National and International Performing Arts Treasures, in a unique Festival pattern.

This 4th edition of the festival will be spread across the Bhopal city over two days at Minto Hall, Bharat Bhawan, Ravindra Bhawan and Iqbal Maidan.

The two-day musical evening will witness the performance of the great artists from all over the world like Hidayat Khan son of the legendary Ustad Vilayat Khan, globally acclaimed as the greatest of all sitarists from New York.

Lydian Nadhaswaram a 13 year old Piano genius win’s the world’s best CBS talent show. Shefali Alvares a good and dynamic Indian Playback Singer going to present Bollywood Jazz. Chandan Das a Legendary Ghazal Singer, Acknowledged by Govt. of India, performed all over the world.

Anuradha Pal, first professional female tabla player in the world, Guillaume Barraud a renowned Flute Player.

Joe Alvares and Group the curator of Hriday Drishyam going to perform Jazz, Kathak, and Flamenco. Mame Khan a Sufi and Folk singer from Rajasthan. Apart from these renowned artists, many other renowned artists will perform during the festival.

The Festival will also showcase local Talent from Bhopal and its environs. Last year also the festival has a handful of International tourists who attended the Festival, on personal Invitation.

The Festival is Non-Commercial and is brought completely free to the audience, with an average local attendance of around 30,000 to 40,000 people, each year; and a veritable Artist List that includes the Cream of our Nation’s Talent, HDMF promises an Explosive Future.

Title: Consul General of US, David Ranz, meets Guv at Raj Bhavan
Article:
Governor Lalji Tandon was called on by the Consul General of US David Ranz at Raj Bhavan. Discussions pertaining to trade and investment in Madhya Pradesh took place on this occasion.

Tandon said that there is a wide scope of trade and investment in the field of herbal medicine in Madhya Pradesh. Necessary raw material in abundance is available for this in Madhya Pradesh. He further mentioned that along with commercial benefit this sector will prove helpful in social change too.

He said that the tribal community of the state possesses a unique heritage of medicinal plants and handicraft.

Efforts are being made by the Government for its conservation.

Tandon mentioned that efforts to improve quality of education and expansion in the field of higher education are ongoing constantly in the state.

On informing about passion of American students in large number towards education in Hindi by Consul General Ranz, the Governor informed that the rich heritage of Indian Education Tradition holds a special place in the world.

To take this heritage forward, efforts are being made through Atal Bihari Vajpayee Hindi Vishwavidyalaya. He further stated that Hindi holds a special status in the most spoken languages of the world.

He said that when he was Governor of Bihar, he made efforts for re-establishing prestige of knowledge and philosophy through Indian education system. The glory of the first university of the world Nalanda was revived.

Tandon said that the Indian economy has become part of the world economy today. In accordance, wide scale reforms have been done in trade and investment. Results of revolutionary reforms in industry friendly policies, development of fundamental structure and system along with trade and investment have started yielding results.

Today, there is an environment of enthusiasm in every sector in the country, he added.

The Consul General lauded the works being done in the field of higher education in the State.

He proposed cooperation to the state in this field.

Title: Woman who set herself on fire, dies during treatment
Article:
A 22-year-old woman died on Thursday who had sustained burn injuries after she immolated herself at her house near Old Girls School on January 4 while undergoing treatment.

Later, the deceased, Samreen Khan, was rushed to a nearby hospital where she died on Thursday.

After the police arrived, the body was sent for the post mortem and a case under section 174 of the CrPC was registered.

The women had died after six days of treatment. On the day of incident, Samreen’s brother Sohail and her family members took her to hospital where she died during treatment.

In her statements before death, the deceased said that she was dejected from her life and wanted to end life due to which she committed suicide.

Police said that all possible angles behind the death would be investigated. The reason of deceased’s frustration remained unrevealed and would be investigated.

Meanwhile, a 20-year-old girl was found drowned in a well at Peepalkheda under Gunga police station area on Thursday.

Police said that the deceased Habiba Ali went missing in the morning on Thursday and later she was found drowned in a well and she was rescued and taken to hospital where she was declared.

The body was sent for the post mortem and a case under section 174 of the CrPC was registered.

Title: HC seeks reply from UEPPCB in four weeks
Article:
Hearing on a public interest litigation regarding pollution being generated by factories in the state, the high court of Uttarakhand has directed the Uttarakhand Environment Protection and Pollution Control Board (UEPPCB) to submit its reply within four weeks.

The high court division bench of chief justice Ramesh Ranganathan and justice Alok Kumar Verma has also asked the board to state which steps have been planned to mitigate pollution in the future. During the hearing on Friday, the UEPPCB informed the court that land has been identified in Tehri and Almora districts for setting up two bio-medical waste treatment plants in the state.

In addition to this, letters have been sent to governmental and non-government institutions, asking them to set up treatment plants. It is pertinent to mention here that Udham Singh Nagar resident Himanshu Chandola had filed a public interest litigation in the high court.

The petitioner had stated that more than 32 factories are functioning in the Udham Singh Nagar and Pantnagar areas. The operation of these factories is generating air pollution in the areas, the petitioner had contended.It is worth mentioning here that while successive State Governments have been focusing efforts on encouraging industrial development in the state, affected locals and observers have repeatedly pointed out at the lack of measures to curtail industrial pollution. On the other hand, members of the industrial fraternity aver that they are observing the necessary regulations.

Title: Boy with his earphones on run over by train
Article:
Listening to music using earphones with high volume while commuting proved fatal for a Class-X boy in Rayagada district as he was crushed to death by a train on Thursday evening.

Akash Kondagori was run over by the Rayagada-Sambalpur Tapaswini Express while he was walking on a railway track with earphones plugged in near Khamanasahi.

Reportedly, Akash had gone to a nearby stream with his friend to take bath in afternoon. While walking back to his home, he was listening to music using earphones with high volume. As he could not realise about the express train coming from behind, the train ran over him, killing him on the spot.

Later, some locals spotted his body with a smashed head and a severed leg on the track and called up the railway police. The cops sent the body for postmortem and began an inquiry in this connection.

Title: I killed, 20 injured in bus-truck clash
Article:
A truck driver person was killed and more than 20 passengers were injured when a bus had a head-on collision with the truck at Khulundipani on NH-23 in Deogarh district on Friday.

The deceased’s identity was yet to be ascertained.

Sources said the bus was en route to Angul from Rourkela when the truck coming from Barkote collided with it at Khulundipani under the Barkote police limits.

Locals first rushed all the injured to the Barkote Community Health Centre for treatment. Some critically-injured passengers were later shifted to the District Headquarters Hospital here.

Title: Man plants 20K trees in tribute to his late wife
Article:
Khadala Nayak of Dubapalli village in Ganjam district has set an environment-related example by creating a forest in his five acres of land in remembrance of his late wife. He has planted more than 20,000 plants.

Known as ‘Tree Man’ in the locality, Khadala had started planting trees after his wife encouraged him to work towards environment promotion. But after his wife’s untimely death, he worked more vigorously on his mission.

With the help of his second wife and son, Khadala is taking care of the forest like his near and dear ones. Teachers and students of several educational institutions in the district visit his plantation and admire his endeavour.

“Khadala’s commitment towards environment and his noble idea inspire us a lot to plant trees,” said a local.

Title: N'pada graveyards unprotected, lands grabbed
Article:
Graveyards in Khariar town of Nuapada district are in a shambles due to indifference of the local people as well as the concerned authorities and encroachments by land grabbers.

There are at least six graveyards inside Khariar town and the total land earmarked as Smashan in Government record is about 16 acres. But due to lack of protection and boundary, major parts of the land have been encroached and there is loss of vegetation.

The graveyard located near Tirbandh tank has above nine acres of land, but more than half of it remains under encroachment.

"Hardly one and a half acres of land is now available; the rest has been converted to farm land by people having land adjacent to the Smashan," says a resident of that locality, who demands a demarcation and planting of trees in smasan.

"Construction of a boundary is necessary to restrict encroachment," he further adds.

The graveyard near Gudel bandh tank has about 90 decimals of land but due to encroachment, the area has shrunk.

Another graveyard with 1.46 acres of land located on the side of the Boden RD road is in a shambles too. People of Gadramunda village and three Wards of Khariar town use the for cremation.

The road side entrance of the graveyard is blocked by illegal constructions. Disposal of waste water and garbage by a liquor distillation unit has turned the smasan waterlogged.

The district authority had allotted Rs 2.5 lakh under Gram Panchayat Development Programme for construction of a shed and sinking of a tube well here in 2016. The work was never taken up as the file went missing.

The graveyards which belong to particular castes or religion have been protected like smasan of the Sahu Samaj or the Kabristan. But the general ones are gradually shrinking.

"A day will come when the dead will not even get a place to be cremated or buried," opines Pratap Pattnaik, who is leading an effort to keep the graveyard near Gudhel Bandh plastic free

and clean.

Title: B’ngir cough syrup trade: 3 more arrested
Article:
Acting on a tipoff, a team of police led by Balangir SDPO Srimanta Barik on Friday arrested one Govind Negi and two others in connection with the illegal cough syrup trading.

Negi was arrested from Bhubaneswar.

On November 28, 2019, the Puintala police had seized 10,600 cough syrup bottles and arrested three persons. Thereafter, a special team was constituted under the SDPO to nab the other persons involved in the illegal trade, informed SP Sandeep Sampat at a Press meet held at the Puintala PS.

The arrested persons were identified as Govind Negi, Ajit Nanda and Farooq Khan. Besides, Rs 55,200, three mobile phones and an Inova car were seized from them.

When asked about details of persons involved in the illegal cough syrup trade, the SP parried questions saying police would forward the arrested three accused to court and bring them in remand for further investigation.

“We will take all steps to end the illegal cough syrup trade in Balangir town and other places in the district,” added the SP.

Title: Curtains down on Dhanu Yatra as Kansa killed
Article:
The world famous Dhanu Yatra here ended on Friday night with an open stage pandal playing death of King Kansa at the hands of Lords Krishna and Balaram.

The mighty king finally collapsed on the resplendent pandal of his Ranga Shabha marking the end of the 11-day-long Dhanu Yatra, the biggest open air theatre of the world.

Kansa, after hearing a voice from the heaven about his death and the killer, had taken all precautions to save his life from child Krishna. He killed all the eight children of his sister Devaki. But his death was pre-ordained.

On the invitation of Kansa, two brothers, Krishna and Balaram, had come to Mathura Nagari(Bargarh) for the Dhanu Yatra. Kansa was sure that he would kill the duo as he was unaware of their divine power, and relied more on his muscle power. He fought with them, and was killed. Lord Krishna's incarnation was meant to destroy all the evil forces with the killing of Kansa. Citizens of Mathura heaved a sigh of relief after the demon king’s death. King Ugresan reoccupied the throne.

“Even if the Yatra shows the same event every year, yet we feel it to be totally anew. The experience of the yatra is different and Krishna Bhakti is totally unique,” said some audience. Some State Ministers and Secretaries of various departments paid their visit during the Yatra.

Title: Calendar of illustration on child rights launched
Article:
Calendar of year 2020 which has 12 illustrations by children, produced by Child Rights Observatory, was launched today in Bhopal by Michael Juma, Chief, UNICEF, Madhya Pradesh, along with children and Nirmala Buch, President of Child Rights Observatory, Madhya Pradesh.

Michael Juma, Chief, UNICEF, Madhya Pradesh, said that it is impressive to see child-focused illustrations in the form of calendar critical for raising children's voices on key issues impacting their potentials as well as using available medium for advancing child rights. Considerably pertinent to continue using artwork which perfectly provides child-friendly medium for raising children's voices on child rights issues with a view to get strategic and child centric solutions to enable them realise their aspirations.

Nimala Buch, President of Child Rights Observatory, shared that this calendar has illustration made by adolescents who were part of illustration camp and had expressed their views in this art form on child rights and their illustrations are part of this calendar.

Rani Paraste from Bhopal whose painting is in January month of the calendar had painted a Gond illustration on the right to education. Similarly Riya Sen, student of St Joseph Bhopal shares that her painting is about various child rights and her illustration is in month of November of the calendar.

Anil Gulati, Communication Specialist, UNICEF, Madhya Pradesh, said that illustrations are powerful expression of adolescents of childrights like right to education, violence against children, health, nutrition and child marriage.

Rashmi Saraswat, Raghu Raj Singh, Ritesh Shinde, Anurag and children of seven hills schools and some who had contributed were present today at the launch in seven hills school in new market.

Title: Inform us regarding fire safety in State: HC
Article:
The High Court of Uttarakhand has directed the state government to submit its reply within four weeks regarding the non-availability of basic fire fighting equipment in all government and private schools, banks and offices in the state.

This direction was issued by the division bench of chief justice Ramesh Ranganathan and justice Alok Kumar Verma. The next hearing in the case will be held on February 11.

As per the case details, Khatima resident Vinod had written a letter to the chief justice stating that educational institutions, banks and offices in the state lacked fire safety systems. In places where such equipment has been placed, the condition of the equipment is not up to mark. In places there is no water while in other places there are no fire extinguishers. The petitioner had also stated that the fire service office is not issuing licenses. The high court accepted this letter in the form of a public interest litigation. Taking cognisance of the issues stated in it, the division bench of the high court has directed the state government to submit its response within four weeks.

Title: Rs 28 lakh heist in Saria Electric Power Grid
Article:
Around 25 unidentified armed masked criminals held hostage three people, including two guards at the newly constructed Power Grid at a cost of eighty crores at Mandian village, about 40 km from Giridih and robbing property worth about 28 lakhs.

Police said that the incident is said to be that the criminals kept on robbing at 10 o'clock on Thursday to 4 am this morning. After getting the information, Saria police reached the spot and started investigation.

Sources said that criminals attacked the power grid at around 10 pm on Thursday night, when two security guards namely Bhagwan Rai and Sant Kumar Tiwari, who were on duty.

At around 10 pm, from the southern end of the power grid some criminals came and surrounded them and took away the gun from both of them and after this, the store keeper Rakesh Pandey was also taken hostage. Later they broke the lock of the store and took out electrical tools from there, costing Rs 2 lakhs.

They also took away the coils of two 315 KVA transformers, which were installed on the power grid premises, costing Rs 26 lakh and escaped from the premises at four o'clock in the morning. Later Saria police was alerted by In-Charge of RKS Company, Prahlad Singh. On whose application a case of robbery has been registered in Saria police station.

Title: Rs 904 cr plan, Rs 831 cr non plan for Himachal tribal areas
Article:
Himachal Government was giving special thrust on development of tribal areas of the State so that they could develop at par with the other areas of the State, Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said here.

Presiding over the 47th meeting of Tribal Advisory Council (TAC), Thakur said that several policy decisions were taken by the Council since Single Line Administration had been adopted to solve various issues of the tribal people.

He said that nine percent of the State budget has been earmarked for Tribal Sub Plan for overall development of the tribal areas.

He said that Rs 904 crore Plan and Rs 831 crore Non Plan allocations have been made under the Tribal Sub Plan during the current financial year.

Thakur said Rs 144.17 crore has been earmarked for construction of buildings, roads and bridges, Rs 169.37 crore for education sector, Rs 99.22 crore for health sector and Rs 59.54 crore for irrigation and water supply schemes in the tribal areas.

The Chief Minister said that the Government was ensuring that regular helicopter sorties were being carried out to facilitate the people of the tribal areas.

He said that during the last year 71 helicopter flights were carried out in the tribal areas and 2303 people were benefitted.

He said that the State Government had also taken up the matter for providing subsidy on helicopter services for tribal areas during the year 2018-19 with the Tribal Affairs Ministry, GoI and Rs 4 crore subsidy was received by the Government.

Thakur said that on the initiative of the State Government the Union Tribal Development Ministry had provided an assistance of Rs 70 crore to the State for various developmental activities in the tribal areas during the year 2018-19.

He said that under the Border Area Development Programme the State Government had succeeded to get additional amount of Rs 10 crore during the year 2017-18 and Rs 8.45 crore during the year 2018-19.

During the year 2019-20 under Article 275(1) of the Constitution, Special Central Assistance of Rs 67 crore have been provided by the Union Government to the State.

Chief Minister said that the State Government had also succeeded in sanctioning of three Eklavya Model Residential Schools for the tribal areas of the State which have been opened in Bharmour, Pangi and Lahaul.

He said that the Tribal Affairs Ministry, GoI would provide Rs 56 crore for construction of the buildings of these schools out of which Rs 33.66 crore have been received till date.

He said the State Government had also provided tele-medicine facility for Bharmour and Pangi tribal areas for which the Union Government had provided Rs 2 crore as special assistance during the year 2018-19 and for this year Rs 1.74 crore have been approved.

He said that tele-medicine facility had already been started at Keylong, Kaza and Pooh to facilitate the tribal people.

He said that a Tribal Bhawan was being constructed at Rampur with a cost of Rs 6.79 crore to facilitate the tribal people of Kinnaur and Spiti.

Title: Chas BDO duped of Rs 10.67 lakh
Article:
Block Development Officer, Sanjay Shandilya of Chas in Bokaro, lost over Rs 10.67 lakh after sharing details about his bank account with a person, claiming to be an official of SBI Bank, over the phone, said Gyan Ranjan DySP.

In his complaint to the Sector IV police station in Bokaro, Shandilya submitted that on January 4, he received a call on his mobile and it was said that SBI accountant Amit Kumar is speaking and the BDO has to activate Internet banking, otherwise his account will be closed.

Sanjay Shandilya made the available all data on his mobile without obtaining any information from other side.

He got information in the case on January 7 when he went to the bank. Earlier cyber criminals had defrauded Rs 10.67 lakh from his SBI, Canara and Syndicate banks from January 4 to 6.

While in this regard Shandilya said that he did not share the password with the caller but have shared with four digits of ATM.

He also raised questions on the bank, how his registered mobile number leaked. Officer in-Change cum Inspector Vinod Kumar Singh said that the case had been registered and started its an investigation.

He appealed to the people to avoid such phone calls.

Title: InBriefs
Article:
Punjab to observe road safety week

Chandigarh: Punjab Government in pursuance of the instruction of Union Ministry of Road Transport & Highways has decided to observe road safety week from January 11 to 17. A spokesperson said, instructions in this regard have been issued to all Deputy Commissioners to observe the road safety week and to ensure the participation of all the concerned agencies like Police, Health, Information and Publicity, Education, PWD B & R and NGOs. At the district level, various kind of events and functions would be organized like Road Shows, March by Students, Paining Contests, Eye Checkup of Drivers, Holding Seminars through NGO’s and Short Messages through FM Radios.

6 ex-Punjab cops convicted in 27-yr-old case

Mohali: Six former Punjab police officials were held guilty by the CBI court here in a 27-year-old case of disappearance of six members of a family from Tarn Taran district. Mohali's Special Judge Karunesh Kumar sentenced former Inspector Suba Singh, and sub-inspectors Bikramjit Singh and Sukhdev Singh to ten years in jail while another Sub- Inspector Sukhdev Raj Joshi was sentenced to five years in jail. The special judge also sentenced Sub Inspector Lakha Singh and Assistant Sub Inspector Suba Singh to two years in jail.

MCC officers to monitor night shelters

Chandigarh: After the directions of KK Yadav, Commissioner, Municipal Corporation, Chandigarh, senior officers of MCC will monitor night shelters on daily basis and submit report to the Commissioner. There are 10 locations in Chandigarh where night shelters facility has been provided by the MC including in Sector 9D in front of CHB Off, 16A near hospital gate, Opposite PGI gate, 19B on V5, 20D near Mandir, 22C opposite JW Marriott, 32B near hospital gate, 34A opposite booth market, 43D in bus stand. The MCC has provided complaint register to improve the facilities in shelters as per requirement of public on daily basis, a spokesman said.

Underpass near Morinda bus stand

Chandigarh/ Ropar: An underpass would be constructed near the Morinda bus stand at a cost of Rs 20 crore and the work in this regard would start from January 20, said Punjab Cabinet Minister Charanjit Singh Channi. He said, all the process in this regard has been completed. The length of this underpass would be 1580 feet and the width 46 feet. In addition to this underpass, service road would be constructed on both sides. This R.U.B. would be covered with a shed and the lights would be fitted inside it as well.

India against road crash 2020 campaign: NGO

Chandigarh: Believing in “Sadak Suraksha – Jeevan Raksha”, NGO- Drive Smart Drive Safe- along with Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) , CII & many other like-minded organisations have launched the campaign titled IndiaAgainstRoadCrash #IARC2020 during the 31st National Road safety week as announced by the Union Ministry of Road Transport & Highways. Schools and Colleges in the tricity will also be roped in the campaign. The objective of the campaign is to start a sustainable chain of nationwide activities, which will not only make people aware and transform their behaviour on roads but it will also lead to formation of road safety clubs among corporates, institutions & organizations at various locations and make Indian roads safer for everyone.

Environ Department to launch course

Chandigarh: The Department of Environment, Chandigarh will launch a course on “ETP/STP/CETP Operation and Maintenance’’, under Green Skill Development Programme. This is 45-day training course which aims to cover the techniques, tools, and processes involved in the Operation and Maintenance of ETPs/STPs/CETPs. The course will begin on January 13 at Conference Hall, Homibhabha Block, NITTTR, Sector 26 here. Debendra Dalai, IFS, CCF & Director Environment, Chandigarh will be the chief guest on the occasion.

Training on “HIV/AIDS & ART” for students

Chandigarh”A five days training course on HIV/AIDS and ART was organized by National Institute of Nursing Education, (NINE) from January 6 to 10 under the guidance of Dr. Karobi Das, Officiating Principal, NINE, PGIMER. Prof Arvind Rajwanshi, Dean (Academics), PGIMER was the chief guest for the valedictory session. He emphasized on the role of nurses in prevention and management of HIV/AIDS and shared his experiences, with the participants. A total of 127 students of B.Sc. Nursing (4 years) interns & B.Sc. Nursing (Post Basic) 2nd year participated in the training course.

woman wins VR Punjab’s Wedding Box 3 contest

Mohali: VR Punjab has announced the much-awaited winner of its ‘Wedding Box 3’ contest. Chandigarh resident Simranjeet Kaur is declared the winner of the contest and presented gifts worth Rs 1 lakh by VR Punjab. Wedding Box 3 contest was held from November 22 to December 15.

India’s Best Dancer invites for auditions

Chandigarh: Following the success of its kids dance reality show – Super Dancer, Sony Entertainment Television will now give a platform to talent over 15 to 30 years of age through India’s Best Dancer. The first audition of the show will be held in Chandigarh on January 16 at Gurukul Global School, adjoining Police Station, Manimajra, near IT Park, Chandigarh.

Dietetics Day observed

Chandigarh: The Indian Dietetic Association (IDA), Chandigarh Chapter celebrated its “National Dietetics Day” on the theme “Dietitians: Reaching the Unreached”. The Convenor, IDA, Chandigarh Chapter Dt. Sunita Malhotra, Chief Dietitian and Head, Department of Dietetics said every year National Dietetics Day is celebrated on January 10 on different themes. PGIMER organized a workshop cum Nutrition Education Program for Anganwadi mothers at Sector - 24. The women were apprised about healthy nutrition and balanced diet.

Title: TTPS takes 10 schools for quality improvement
Article:
The NTPC Talcher Thermal Power Station (TTPS) has started a drive to bring in qualitative improvement in the school education in its peripheral villages on part of its CSR initiative.

In this regard, 10 Government middle schools have been identified for implementation of the RastriyaAbhiskarAbhiyan(RAA) activities. The programme will enable children to become motivated and engaged in Science, Mathematics and Technology (SMT) through observation, experimentation, inference drawing, model building, rational reasoning and testability. Besides, the teachers from selected schools would be equipped with latest tools (Computer simulations, audio / visual content) and techniques (latest research on child psychology and pedagogy) used in teaching. The effectiveness of the programme would also be measured through national level competitions like NTSE and children science congress.

The NTPC Talcher Thermal has engaged UNISED (Unit of Science and Educational Development ) of IIT, Kanpur for the programme. And the UNISED has started installing the hardware in the 10 selected schools.

Title: Now, H & UD Dept comes under Mo Sarkar
Article:
Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Friday announced inclusion of the Housing and Urban Development Department in the Mo Sarkar initiative of the State Government.

The department would bring in professionalism and effect behavioural change under the Mo Sarkar initiative, said an official release.

“I am glad that our initiative to bring all the departments under Mo Sarkar by March 31, this year is catching up momentum. The Housing and Urban Development Department is coming under Mo Sarkar initiative today,” said the Chief Minister.

Considering the rapid urbanisation, and the growing demand for modern infrastructure for providing efficient amenities, the H and UD is one of the most important wings of the Government, he said.

“While we are set to provide quality drinking water to all the households in urban areas, we are also providing basic rights to urban poor through Jaga Mission. The Jaga Mission has received World Habitat Award for providing land rights to more than 50,000 urban poor families. The Drink from Tap Mission in Bhubaneswar is one of the most promising initiatives i taken up by this department,” he said.

The Department is fully prepared to function under the Mo Sarkar. Necessary capacity building, technology up-gradation and awareness efforts have been taken up.

“One of the basic objectives of Mo Sarkar is every public servant must understand that the citizen is the master. The public servant is here to serve the citizens. There should be a conviction on this vision. So I would like to ask every public servant to treat the citizens with dignity,” he reiterated.

He hoped that the department would successfully implement the Mo Sarkar programme and fulfil people’s aspirations.

H and UD Minister Pratap Jena said the department has already opened Mo Sarkar cells to facilitate the provisions of the initiative, he informed.

On the occassion, 5-T Secretary VK Pandian interacted with Executive Officers of Patnagarh, Rairangpur, Bonei, Rajgangpur, Athamallick, Talcher, Jeypore and Kabisuryanagar to know about their understanding on Mo Sarka. He appreciated that most of the officers have quite significant awareness on Mo Sarkar. He advised the officials that there should be no harassment of any citizen coming for any service to any public office.

Title: Inbrief
Article:
OP Jindal School celebrates annual day

Angul: Students of OP Jindal School mesmerised the audience celebrating school’s 10th annual function ‘Taarunyaam’ here recently. Chief guest JSPL Odisha COO Pankaj Gautam lauded the performance of students, who presented their talent on the stage. Meritorious students of Class-X and XII were awarded with merit certificates. The evening witnessed a cultural programme ‘Taarunyam’. Among others, Jindal Mahila Samiti president Pratibha Gautam, JSPL HR and ES VP Alok Malhotra and school Principal Chhanda Charan Das were present. JSPL Foundation chairperson Shallu Jindal sent a note of congratulation to the students and school authorities.

NTPC Kaniha receives 1st coal rakes

Talcher: The NTPC Talcher Kaniha is strategically moving ahead with long-term fuel security plan to fulfill its coal requirement for the 3,010 MW power station which includes 3,000 MW thermal and 10 MW solar power. In order to fulfill its coal requirement, the station has received coal from the NTPC Dulanga Mines located at Jharsuguda on Thursday. The station received coal consignment of 3,350 metric tonne (MT) from 57 wagons through road-cum-railway mode. On the occasion, NTPC CGM Sudip Nag received the coal rakes with traditional welcome by breaking coconuts along with GMs and HoDs.

‘Asli Happiness Wala Sale’ at Esplanade One

Bhubaneswar: The Esplanade One has announced flat 50 per cent off for three days which gives customers a chance to shop their hearts out with some very popular brands as part of ‘Asli Happyness Wala Sale’ from Friday. Participating customers will have a variety to choose from with Max, Global Desi, Being Human, Hamleys, Big Bazaar, Reliance Trends, Home Centre and Kazo among others. Children can take part in the fashion show and drawing competition and win prizes, gift vouchers, certificates and much more.

Title: MNAC takes steps, asks Jusco to clean, maintain road median
Article:
Concern over waste materials dumped on Dimna Road, the gateway to Jamshedpur from NH-33, in Mango the local civic body has started taking steps for cleanliness ahead of the Swachchh Survekshan 2020.

With assessors expected to carry out surprise verification under Union Urban Development Ministry as part of Swachh Survekshan 2020, the Mango Notified Area Committee (MNAC) has written a letter to Jusco senior GM (Jamshedpur Town Operation) Dhananjay Mishra for cleaning and maintenance of the road median.

“We are taking every step to ensure cleanliness in view of the survey. We are taking steps for smooth movement of vehicles on the Dimna Road. During a meeting we came to know that that the nearly 3.5 km long central verge of the Dimna Road has virtually turned dumping yard. The road is maintained by Jusco and today we asked to undertake regular cleaning and maintenance as is being done in other roads in Jamshedpur city under Jusco command area,’ said MNAC special officer Deepak Sahay.

The four-lane Dimna Road, which stretches for 3.5km, is the entry point to the steel city from NH-33 and witnesses a steady flow of heavy vehicles.

The road hosts several business establishments and apartments.

Nearly 50,000 vehicles cross the stretch daily and peak-hour snarls, especially near Mango roundabout where illegal parking is rampant, are a nightmare.

The four-lane New Purulia Road, which links Mango with densely populated areas such as Azadnagar and Jawaharnagar, and hosts popular addresses like Payal Talkies, the State forest guesthouse and Mango police station, witnesses unauthorised parking every day. Congestion woes are similar on Old Purulia Road, which links Mango to Kapali in neighbouring Seraikela-Kharsawan district.

“Moreover the vegetable vendors’ dumps their vegetables while nearby shopkeepers dump their waste inside the central verge.

We have asked Jusco to clean the waste and undertake yellow and black paints on the walls of the central verge as has been done on central verges of roads maintained by Jusco under their command areas,’ said Deepak Sahay.

It may be mentioned that Mango was placed 95 in the Swachh Survekshan 2019 and though serious efforts have been initiated in door-to-door cleaning of waste and other parameters but the Dimna Road littered with waste due to vegetable vendors and residents is yet to be taken care of .The Mango Notified Area Committee (MNAC), offers urban amenities to a population of nearly 3 lakh.

Title: HC to reopen on Feb 10 after winter vacation
Article:
The winter vacation in the high court of Uttarakhand has been declared from January 11. The high court will now reopen on February 10. However, one court will remain open to take up urgent matters during the winter vacation.

The high court registrar general informed that justices NS Dhanik, RC Khulbe, Alok Kumar Verma and Ravindra Maithani will preside over hearing of urgent and important cases in the first, second, third and fourth week respectively of the winter vacation.

Title: SBPS celebrates Annual Day with fervor
Article:
Marking the completion of a decade of dedication to the society, Sarala Birla Public School, Ranchi celebrated its Annual Day ‘Shraddha - Mati ko Naman’ with great fervour here on Friday. The spectacular morning began with the welcome and lamp lighting ceremony by Chief Guest Prof. (Dr.) Raman Kumar Jha, Vice Chancellor, Amity University, Guest of Honour, Dr. KC Prasad, Head Personnel and Admin Pradip Varma, Principal Paramjit Kaur and other eminent guests.

The cultural programme began with the welcome song ‘Shat Shat Naman’ followed by the Orchestra- 'Ode to Joy'. The audience was highly appreciative of the soulful symphony of the budding musicians. The highlight of the programme was the dance drama titled 'Mati ko Naman', through which the students celebrated the four strands of history i.e. the 550th birth anniversary of Gurunanank Devji, 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, 100 years of Jaliawala Bagh and 90 years of Dandi March. The act depicted the sacrifice made by our freedom fighters for the uplift of the Indian society and the social evils which prevailed in the society. It ended on a sanguine note that the future is very illuminating as we endeavour to overcome these challenges.

Through the programme, students paid homage to Swami Vivekananda and B. K. Birla, whose birth anniversaries fall on 12th January. They tried to depict that the youth is eager to follow the footsteps of these leaders to be victorious in all spheres of life. The cultural programme was an amalgamation of various hues befitting the theme wondrously. The grandeur of the programme left the audience enthralled. The programme culminated with the proposal of the vote of thanks followed by the school song and the national anthem.

Addressing the gathering, Chief Guest Prof. (Dr.) Raman Kumar Jha appreciated the efforts taken by the school management and advised everyone to leave two things i.e. laziness and haziness and develop alertness and clarity. He also encouraged everyone to establish good relationship and understanding amongst themselves to have a happy and prosperous life.

Guest of Honour Dr. K. C. Prasad appreciated the Multi-dimensional education provided at SBPS and said that our society preserves many gems and it is our duty to show them the right path which is very well accomplished at SBPS. He also suggested the students to develop self – confidence by emulating Gandhiji and Swami Vivekananda.

School Head Personnel and Admin Pradip Varma said that it was a spectacular show put up by the children. He congratulated the entire SBPS team for the completion of a successful 10 years and said that the school is going to scale new heights with the continuous and constant support of everyone.

Principal Paramjit Kaur spoke about the plethora of opportunities that the school offers to the students and about the incredible work and progress made by the school in the span of a decade. She also commended the contribution of various people in the growth of the school.

Title: Cashless health card scheme on anvil for employees
Article:
The Uttarakhand government has decided to restore the benefit of cashless medical care facility for its employees. A proposal in this regard is likely to be brought before the state cabinet soon.

The measure would bring much needed relief for almost three lakhs serving and retired employees of the state government. After the launch of the Atal Ayushman Uttarakhand Yojana (AAUY), the state government had suspended the cash less card scheme, the U health card scheme.

The secretary (in-charge) of medical health and family welfare department, Pankaj Kumar Pandey told The Pioneer that after discussion with the employee organisations and the experts the department has prepared a draft of the cash less scheme.

The issue of the cash less health facility for the government employees was raised by the Congress members during the recent one day special session of Uttarakhand assembly. The employee organisations however are keeping their fingers crossed about the new provisions of the government.

The officiating general secretary of the Rajya Karmchari Sanyukt Parishad (RKSP), Arun Pandey told The Pioneer that the employees want that the benefits similar to the Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) should be provided to the employees. He said that the compulsion of the referral from a government hospital to the private hospital should be removed for the employees. Pandey said that treatment in the Out Patient Department (OPD) should also be included in the scheme.

The employees want that the renowned multi-specialty hospitals in private sector should be brought into the panel of the scheme and the practice of referral from the government hospitals should be done away for them.

It is expected that the an annual premium of Rs 4800 would be charged from the employee having grade pay in excess of Rs 6600 while those getting a grade pay of Rs 4200 to Rs 5400, a sum of Rs 3600 per annum is expected to be levied. For employees with less grade pay a sum of Rs 100 per month is expected to be charged.

Title: Sacred Heart alumna pens biography on Sister Flavian
Article:
Sister Flavian, who served as the principal of Sacred Heart Convent School for the longest tenure of 12 years, now has a book based on her life. The famous educationalist, who not only took Scared Heart to new heights but also played instrumental role in setting up of Carmel Junior College, has a biography titled ‘The Smiling Nun’ set to be released on Saturday.

Penned by her former student, Swagata Dey the book captures her role in spreading education and his never dying spirit that brought change in lives of several of her students.

The project was started by her student Swagata Dey from Kolkata in 2016 when she joined hands together with people whose lives were touched by Sister Flavian. The book compiles work, life and attributes of her everyday life. She served as principal of Scared Heart Convent School from 1986 to 1998

“The project is a celebration of her tireless efforts known and unknown. We want to encapsulate and portray her identity to the world,” said Dey. Sister Flavian’s book will surely prove to be a great inspiration for the coming generation.

The book has been published by Creation Graphics, Kolkata and contains her lifelong eminent work portrayed along with captured glimpses , all accumulated together over the course of time.

Principal of Greenfiled School and former student of Scared Heart Convent School, Ekta Agarwal, said that Sister Flavian possesses inspiring personality. Her students too have penned thoughts on her in the book.

Born on June 5, 1936 in a family of three brothers and three sisters in an aristocratic family in Mangalore city in Karnataka, Flavie Dsouza ( Sister Flavian) was the fifth child. She was fond of all the little happiness and enjoyment life could bring though she longed to take up teaching as her profession.

After her schooling at the age of 19 she gave her luxurious life and decided to join the congregation of The Apostolic Carmel. Hence her long and eventful journey began from Sacred Heart School Jamshedpur. One by one she accomplished the goals she set for herself.

She headed many schools as the principal of Carmel School Patna, Carmel School Hazaribagh, Sacred heart Jamshedpur and Carmel School Buxar. She was the founder and Principal of Carmel Junior College in Sonari Jamshedpur. CJC was the youngest school which flourished during her tenure. She also took over Bal Vihar - a school for the hearing impaired while she was in Sonari Jamshedpur. Apart from the schools where she taught and where she headed she has a big contribution to many lives by building them up capable for doing jobs, educating, showing them the right path, bringing them to light from dark.

Title: AAP protests over power tariff hike in Punjab
Article:
Police used water canons on Friday to stop the Aam Aadmi Party workers protesting against the hike in power tariff in Punjab from moving towards chief minister Amarinder Singh's residence here.

The main opposition party also sought scrapping of power purchase agreements signed during previous SAD-BJP regime with private plants.

The protest was led by Sangrur MP Bhagwant Mann. Several party MLAs including Harpal Singh Cheema, Kultar Singh Sandhwan and Baljinder Kaur participated in the massive protest.

AAP leaders claimed that party workers sustained injuries because of the water cannon and several party workers were taken into custody by the police.

Power rates in Punjab were increased by 36 paise a unit with effect from January 1 for domestic consumers.

The party leaders alleged that power consumers were being forced to pay between Rs 9 and Rs 12 a unit which was "much higher" as compared to electricity rates in other states.

Mann said on the one hand, Punjab which produces own electricity, was selling electricity to consumers at higher rates and on the other hand, the Kejriwal-led government in Delhi, which produces not even a single unit of power, was providing “cheapest” electricity to the people there.The AAP said the Congress before coming to power had promised to review the power purchase agreements but failed to do so despite being in power for more than two and a half years now.AAP leaders also claimed that there had been recurring hike in electricity rates allegedly because of the pressure of the private power companies.

Title: Rs 80 lakh cheating case: Man arrested
Article:
Giridih police today busted a high-profile international gang involved in cheating people and arrested a Nigerian citizen from Pune city of Maharashtra. The gang used to cheat people in the name of herbal chemical. The Giridih police was looking for this gang in a case of a fraud of Rs 80 lakh. Three members of the gang are still at large, said Cyber cell DySP Sandeep Suman.

Superintendent of police Surendra Kumar Jha, while holding a press conference today at police line, told the media that the Nigerian Maugo Chanho Henry cheated Rs 80 lakh in the name of import-export business of herbal chemical from Nirmal Jhunjhunwala, a resident of Giridih city. The total deal for the chemical business, was finalized for Rs 1.03 crore from the city businessman, Nirmal Jhunjhunwala.

“Nirmal Jhunjhunwala smelled the rat in deal when the matter of paying the remaining Rs 23 lakh came to light,” said Jha. Meanwhile, Jhunjhunwala informed the issue to SP Surendra Kumar Jha of the district. After taking information of the entire matter from Jhunjhunwala, an SIT was constituted on the instruction of Giridih SP, which reached Mumbai and carried out a detailed investigation.

The Giridih police during the course of investigation came to know that that Maugo Henry was hiding in Pune, and raided in Pune to arrest him.

The police also came to know that he is a student of Henry Elias aka Dr Alex David Law College.

Police has also recovered several cans of herbal chemicals from the possession of arrested person. According to Giridih Police, there are four more members of this gang who are from different cities of India.

These include Pamela, Raymond Benson, Sunita Joshi and Sanjay Joshi, three of which are absconding. At present, the police are investigating the entire matter closely.

Title: Six officers, contractor held in Cuttack
Article:
The Vigilance police on Thursday arrested seven persons, including six Government officers and a contractor, for their alleged involvement in tender fixing and misappropriation of funds in construction of a bridge over the Taldanda Canal in Cuttack.

The accused alleged misappropriated over Rs 43.16 lakh Government money during the execution of the bridge project from 2014-15 to 2018-19, informed a Vigilance release.

The arrestees were identified as Assistant Executive Engineer Rajanikanta Dalabehera, Assistant Engineer Rabinarayan Sahu, retired Divisional Account Officer Abanikanta Rout, Assistant Engineer Ranjan Kumar Debata, retired Executive Engineer Sudhir Kumar Panda, retired Superintending Engineer Bimal Chandra Dash and contractor Trupti Ranjan Debata.

Probe revealed that contractor Debata submitted bid papers for award of the work by furnishing a false “No relation certificate” in violation of terms and conditions of the tender though his elder brother Ranjan Kumar Debata was working as Assistant Engineer under the R and B Division, Cuttack.

The tender was accepted by Superintending Engineer Bimal Chandra Das for Rs 2,12,53,801 and an agreement was executed on January 1, 2015 with contractor Debata.

As he had no such working experience, Debata executed a power of attorney and authorised Manas Ranjan Ojha to execute the work. However, actually his brother AE Ranjan Kumar Debata was executing the work and there has been monetary transaction with the power of attorney Ojha, informed the release.

After completion of the work, contractor Trupti Ranjan Debata was paid a sum of Rs 2,02,25,148 by the executive engineer towards bill amount based on the measurements and check measurements taken by the assistant engineers and assistant executive engineers without any bills and invoices from authorised/designated dealer in support of purchase of steel, it said.

Further, an amount of Rs 43,16,044 has been misappropriated by the above Government officials in connivance with the contractor by falsely showing excess utilisation of iron rods and cement and allowing payment in excess of the estimated cost, the release said.

Title: BJP loses face as Cong wins Korba too
Article:
Despite falling short of the BJP in the head count of corporators, the Congress managed to get elected its candidate as Mayor of the Korba Municipal Corporation in a closely contested election on Friday.

Cabinet minister Jaisingh Agrawal closely monitored the election in which the ruling party candidate Rajkishor Prasad won the mayoral post by just one vote.

Rajkishor got 34 votes while his closest contender Ritu Chourasia of the BJP got 33 votes.

Notably, BJP had registered the victory in 31 wards in the 67-ward municipal corporation. The Congress had only 26 corporators, so winning the mayoral election was not an easy task for the party.

The ten candidates of the BSP and Chhattisgarh Janta Congress (Jogi) and independent played a crucial role in deciding the new Mayor.

With this victory, the Congress has managed to grab all 10 Mayoral posts in Chhattisgarh.

Title: CM seeks Center’s help in bio-ethanol’s sales promotion
Article:
Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has written a letter to the NITI Aayog with a request to fix an attractive selling price for bio-ethanol (produced from additional paddy procured in the state) so as to promote its sale.

Baghel has also requested that the mandate of taking approval from the Union Agriculture Ministry every year for production of bio-ethanol should be do away with as it is impractical.

Chief Minister has requested the NITI Aayog to take necessary action on both these points at Central government level in the larger interest of the farmers.

Chief Minister has stated in the letter to the Aayog that under National Bio-Fuel Policy-2018 and Chhattisgarh's Industrial Policy, the decision has been taken to promote establishment of bio-ethanol plants with the additional paddy procured in the state.

Private investment is also being invited by Industry Department for establishing bio-ethanol plants in the state. But to attract private investment in this area, it is important that the selling price of bio-ethanol is attractive and it is also necessary that the mandate of annual approval for its production should be dissolved.

Baghel further stated in the letter that the price of bio-ethanol produced from paddy should be kept at par with the rates of ethanol produced from syrup, sugar and sugar syrup.

Title: Govt to launch malaria eradication drive in Bastar from January 15
Article:
State government is going to launch a month-long malaria eradication drive in the disease prone Bastar region of the state from January 15.

Health Minister T.S. Singhdeo on Friday took a review meeting of the entire Bastar region at medical college premises in Jagdalpur.

Notable, around 73 percent malaria cases are found in this tribal heartland of the state and the maximum deaths is also registered here.

Meanwhile, speaking at the review meeting the health minister said there are a couple of diseases which are also on the radar of the health ministry namely anemia and malnutrition which will automatically be controlled with the elimination of malaria.

“Repeated ailment from malaria results in anemia in pregnant woman and this increases the possibility of a new born infant being gripped with malnutrition”, he said.

Instructing the district collectors and health officials, on this occasion, the minister said the drive must be taken on top priority and active participation of all the government departments must be ensured.

The minister further informed the official that the malaria kits to test blood samples and required medicines are available with the health department to succeed in this challenging job.

Title: Two cops injured in Naxal encounter
Article:
Two police personnel were injured in an encounter with naxals in Chhattisgarh's insurgency-hit Sukma district on Friday, an official said.

The gunfight took place in a forest under the Chintalnar police station limits, about 500 km south from state capital Raipur.

Naxals fired on a team of District Reserve Guards (DRG) when they were cordoning off the forest which is on the border of Sukma and Bijapur districts, a senior police official said.

"Two DRG personnel sustained bullet injuries. Firing is still going on intermittently. We are waiting for further reports," he said. The injured personnel were being evacuated, he added.

Title: ‘No dearth of funds to develop Raipur’
Article:
Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said there was no dearth of funds for development of capital Raipur.

Baghel was addressing at the swearing-in ceremony of newly elected Mayor and Chairman of Raipur Municipal Corporation.

On demand of newly elected Mayor of capital city Raipur, Aijaj Dhebar, the Chief Minister further assured that funds would not be an impediment in development of the city.

Admitting that the face of capital reflects the development of entire state, he assured of all possible help from the government side for makeover of the capital as per the need.

He said that the newly-elected public representatives of local urban body of Raipur have a major responsibility in city's development on their shoulder.

Chief Minister added that these public representatives had the potential to give a distinct identity to Chhattisgarh with their efforts and initiatives.

Chief Minister said that people had a confidence and a high-level of trust on the elected public representatives. “Now, it is their responsibility to live up to the expectations of people,” he said.

He said that state government's schemes were emphasizing on all-round development of all 'individuals' of the state.

This was our goal, he said. He further reiterated that the government was determined to bring about major positive changes in education, health, and employment sector of Chhattisgarh.

Also present on this occasion were Agriculture Minister Ravindra Choubey, Member of Rajya Sabha Chhaya Verma, Urban Administration Minister Dr Shiv Daharia, MLAs Mohan Markam, Satyanarayan Sharma, Kuldeep Juneja, Vikas Upadhyay, Anita Yogendra Sharma.

Mayor Aijaj Dhebar in his address expressed his commitment to establish the identity of Raipur city as clean, beautiful pollution-free city. “As per Chief Minister's vision of 'Gadhbo Nava Chhattisgarh', we will focus on providing every basic facility in the city along with effective implementation of government schemes”, he said.

Title: CM to watch ‘Chhapaak’ today
Article:
Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel will be going to watch "Chhapaak"- film based on the story of an acid attack survivor, on Saturday.

Chhattisgarh Government has made "Chhapaak" tax-free.

Chief Minister stated in his tweet that this movie shows the consequences of heinous crime of acid attack on women and creates public awareness.

Chhattisgarh Government has decided to make this film tax-free, so that people are encouraged to watch it and become aware of the subject.

Title: Youth fest to enthrall audiences from tomorrow
Article:
Inauguration of three-day long grand gala state-level youth fest will be done on Sunday. There will be a confluence of youth’s talent, skill, energy and enthusiasm in it.

This year at the State-level Youth Festival, mesmerizing performances of Chhattisgarhi folk music and folk dance such as Karma, Raut nacha, Panthi, Sarhul, Suva, Danda, Bastariya dance will be staged along with classical music such as Hindustani style, Carnatic style, classical dance such as Katthak, Odyssey, Kuchipudi, Manipuri, Bharatnatyam.

Also, for the first time, Chhattisgarhi food festival will also be organised at the youth fest. On the occasion of Swami Vivekananda Jayanti, the state’s Sports and Youth Welfare Department is organising the three-day youth event from January 12.

The youth fest will be inaugurated at the main stage built in Directorate of Sports premise in capital city Raipur at 10am. As many as 821 different performances will be staged on the occasion.

On the first day of the event, folk dance Karma Nacha will be staged at the main stage of Sports Directorate premise, and Raut Nacha will be presented at the open stage and another folk dance will be staged at the second stage.

Essay and painting competitions will be organised from 1pm to 6pm in the hall of Directorate of Sports. From 1pm to 6.30pm, competitions of folk music, classical Hindustani and Carnatic music, guitar and sitar playing will be organised at Pt Deendayal Upadhyay Auditorium.

At Pt Ravishankar Shukla University, monologues will be staged from 1pm to 7pm, and Tabla playing competition will be held in Science College Auditorium from 1pm to 8pm. Sports competition will be organised at the open ground in the university campus.

On January 13, folk dance Sarhul will be staged at the main stage of Directorate of Sports premise from 9am to 7pm, Suva dance, Danda naach will be staged at second stage, and Panthi, Bastariha dance will be performed at the open stage. At Pt Deendayal Auditorium, Kathak, Odyssey, Kuchipudi, Manipuri dance competitions, Bharatnatyam and traditional costume competitions, and flute playing competition will be organized from 9am to 6pm.

Likewise from 9am to 9pm at Pt Ravishankar Shukla University Auditorium, monologue competition, will be held and from 9am to 6pm at Science College Auditorium, harmonium, mridangam and veena playing competition will be organized.

Similarly, on the concluding day, rock band performance will be staged at the main stage, and other competitions will be held at the open stage, while final round of quiz competition will be held in the hall from 10am to 12pm.

Title: K’mal job fair: 7K youths placed in 71 firms
Article:
As many as 7,000 rural youths were placed in 71 companies at the two-day mega job fair in Kandhamal organised by Kandhamal MP Dr Achyuta Samanta in cooperation with the district administration.

The fair was a resounding success with rural youths, mostly having under matric qualifications, getting jobs with salary ranging from Rs 10,000 to Rs 20,000 in well established companies. Over 14,000 youths from Kandhamal participated in the job mela, while 12,000 youths registered.

On Thursday, the fair was conducted at Phulbani in which more than 12,000 youths from Kandhamal, Nayagarh and Ganjam districts attended and out of them 10000 registered. As many as 6,300 youths were selected for placement and out of them, 5,000 were selected on the spot and 1,300 were selected for placement after completing training.

On Friday, the fair was organised at Boudh where 2,000 youths from Kantamal and Boudh Block registered.

Title: E-Summit begins at IIT BBSR
Article:
The sixth edition of the three-day annual Entrepreneurial Conclave of Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Bhubaneswar ‘E-Summit’20’ was inaugurated by Niti Aayog Member Dr Ramgopal Agarwala and IIT (ISM) Dhanbad Board of Governors Chairman Prof DD Misra here on Friday.

The event was presided over by IIT BBS Director Prof RV Raja Kumar.

Dr Agarwala motivated the students to work on innovative ideas and inculcating spirit of entrepreneurship thereby contributing to the progress of the nation.

Welcoming the participants, Prof Kumar said that the entrepreneurs in today’s competitive world are the nation’s pride. Among others, IIT BBS Student Affairs Dean Prof VR Pediredi, E-summit Vice-Chairman Dr Suvradip Mullick and Registrar Col (Dr) Subodh Kumar were present.

Title: Pracheen convocation in city tomorrow
Article:
The Chandigarh-based Pracheen Kala Kendra (PKK) will hold a convocation of the successful students of Visharad (B Mus) and Bhaskar final (M Mus) of the sessions 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 belonging to Odisha here on January 12.

Its secretary Sajal Koser, registrar Shobha Koser, regional coordinator Dr Basanta Kumar Mishra, North Eastern Kolkatta Office sub registrar Ananda Ranjan Borua and supertending accountant Byomakesh Jena informed this while addressing a Press conference here on Friday.

Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy will be the chief guest and Rajya Sabha MP Padmavibhushan Shilpi Guru Raghunath Mahapatra will be the guest of honour of the convocation. Dr Kirtan Narayan Padhi, eminent musicologist and linguist, will deliver the keynote address. Poet Rakhyaka Naya, music director Padmashree Prafulla Kara, Tabala artist Pandit Umesh Chandra Kar, writer -journalist Himanshu Khatua will be felicitated for their outstanding work.

Successful students of Visharad and Bhaskar courses will be awarded diplomas while meritorious candidates will be presented a medal and a certificate of merit. A well-knit musical programme will follow.

Title: Hackathon on VR, AR begins at IIT
Article:
A three-day conclave and Hackathson on ‘Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR)’ organised by the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Bhubaneswar in association with the Software Technology Parks of India (STPI) and State Government began at IIT BBS campus here on Friday.

STPI DG Omkar Rai, Electronic and Information Technology Secretary Manoj Kumar Mishra and IIT BBS Director Prof RV Raja Kumar attended as guests and inaugurated the programme.

Prof Kumar emphasised the importance of new age technologies such as AR and VR, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Internet of things (IOT) and 5G communication, in the Digital India dream, today. He acknowledged the support from Susmita Bagchi and Subroto Bagchi of the Odisha Skill Development Authority for joining hands together with the institute for creation of Center of Excellence in AR-VR (VARCoE) at the institute.

The VARCoE focuses on creating an ecosystem for carrying out R and D in AR-VR, immersive visualization and applications, giving impetus to skill development, manpower creation through innovative education program and foster technology incubation and entrepreneurship. Among others, Prof PK Sahu, Prof M Sabarimalai Manikandan, Manas Panda and Prasant Biswal were present.

Title: 2 held for selling cough syrup, tablets
Article:
Police on Friday arrested two youths here on the charge of selling cough syrup and seized 25 sealed Escuf Syrup bottles and 20 Nitrozepam tablets. The youths were identified as Sonu Behera of Modipara hospital campus and Surendra Kumar Dauria of Thelkopada.

The police also seized a mobile phone and a Pulsar motorcycle, cash of Rs 2,500.

As per information, during patrolling on Wednesday night, the Dhanupali police found a youth standing in a dark place with a pulsar motor cycle near the Gopalji temple.

Title: B'swar girl rescued; kidnapper held
Article:
The Nilgiri police after rescuing a kidnapped minor girl of the area from Maharashtra have arrested the accused.

The accused was identified as Samir Ramarao of Amravati district of Maharashtra.

According to reports , the victim, a minor girl of Shymsundarpur GP of Nilgiri, came in contact with the accused following a wrong number call.

Their relationship further deepened through social media chatting.

While their intimacy grew further, she was allegedly kidnapped by the accused from Nilgiri.

The parents of the victim after not finding their daughter had lodged an FIR with police on December 15.

The Nilgiri police registering a case of kidnapping had begun an investigation.

Further, the police by tracking the numbers of both accused and victim and their call details tracked them in Amravati district.

Title: Tata Steel BBSR Literary Meet kicks off
Article:
A three-day 5th edition of the Tata Steel Bhubaneswar Literary Meet (TSBLM) was inaugurated on Friday by renowned economist Lord Meghnad Desai and literary scholar Perumal Murugan.

Lord Desai spoke about how recent developments across geographies are shaping the world as “we stand at the cusp of the new decade”.

This was followed by a session of the translation of the seminal Odia book on the political emancipation of women, Basanti, by noted scholars of Odia culture Anant Mahapatra, Himansu Mohapatra and Malabika Roy. The day ended with an engaging performance by YouTube sensation and spoken word performer Priya Malik.

Vice-president, Corporate Services, Tata Steel, Chanakya Chaudhary said, “I am sure this year’s edition will once again celebrate unexplored ideas and unstoppable voices.”

Other eminent personalities who will be part of this year’s literary extravaganza include living legend of Hindustani classical music Pandit Hari Prasad Chaurasia, renowned thespian Amol Palekar, journalist Bachi Karkaria, Odia literature Paramita Satpathy Tripathy, actor-director Nandita Das and comedian Biswa Kalyan Rath.

Title: Temperature likely to drop for next few days
Article:
In the next few days, the residents of Jharkhand will have some respite from the winter rains. However, the minimum temperature is likely to drop by a couple of degrees leading to an increase in the chill factor across the State.

The weather bulletin released by the Meteorological Centre, Ranchi on Friday states that from January 10 to January 16, Jharkhand will have dry weather while north westerly winds are likely to prevail over the State.

“On January 10 and January 11, three will a drop in the minimum temperature in Ranch. After that the temperature is expected to rise for a few days. There are no chances of any rainfall in the coming days,” said, Director MET Centre- Ranchi SD Kotal.

There are chances of fog and mist in the early morning hours almost all over Jharkhand. The sky will be clear while the weather will be dry and pleasant in the State.

“A drop in the minimum temperature will be witnessed mostly in all the stations across Jharkhand. This is because as the cloud cover clears away, temperature tends to drop. The wind blowing across will also add to the chill factor,” added the official.

From January 10 to January 16, the minimum temperature is likely to be below normal and may lie in the range of six to 15 degree Celsius. The maximum temperature during the same period is likely to be below normal to normal and may lie in the range of 20 to 27 degree Celsius.

The entire State which received rainfall in the winter season, a cold wave was also witnessed at isolated places in south west part on January 7. From January 1 to January 9, the minimum temperature was above normal by about two to five degrees and was observed in the range of seven to 16 degree Celsius in the State.

According to the communiqué issued by the weather department, from January 11 to January 14, the minimum temperature in Ranchi and its surrounding areas will be around 8 to 13 degree Celsius. The maximum temperature during this time will be around 20 to 23 degree Celsius.

Title: Stage set for Young Leaders Conclave in Doon from today
Article:
The stage is set for the two-day Young Leaders Conclave 2020 to be held to mark the 157th birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda in Dehradun from today.

Youth and intellectuals from across the state and nation will be attending this two-day conclave being organised on the directions of the chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat. This conclave is being held with focus on three points- service, communication and commitment.

According to official sources, a total of 375 youth from various noted educational institutions from across Uttarakhand and India will be participating in this two-day conclave.

The participants will deliberate on issues important also from the view point of development in Uttarakhand. These issues will include mainly human resource development, health, information technology, infrastructure and industry. The Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat will inaugurate the two-day Young Leaders Conclave on Saturday. After the inaugural session, three parallel sessions will be held under subject experts on the first day of the conclave. On the second and concluding day of the conclave, the chief minister will interact with the young participants.

A pledge will also be taken on the concluding day to work towards achieving excellence in the state and nation and using experience for this purpose.

According to state government officials, the idea behind organising the Young Leaders Conclave is communicate with youth and arriving at a conclusion based on the concrete and important inputs received during the event.

The participant adjudged to have the most proactive vision for the future and upliftment of the state will also be felicitated with the title of Nitishri on the occasion.

Title: Pritam objects to CM’s remarks on Rajiv Gandhi
Article:
The Pradesh Congress Committee (PCC) president Pritam Singh has expressed resentment over the statement of Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat in which he had allegedly termed former Prime Minister (PM) Rajiv Gandhi as a coward.

In a statement released on Friday, the PCC president said that it is unfortunate that such utterances are made against the leader of the party which had led the freedom struggle. He added that the leaders of the Congress party have laid down many sacrifices for the country. Former PMs Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi belonging to Gandhi family had scarified their lives for the country.
