The Congress leader said that the statement of CM reflects his mental status. On a stern note, he said that the CM should inform as to where his ancestors were when the freedom struggle was going on and what role did they played in the struggle for independence. He said that late PM Rajiv Gandhi laid the foundation for development of the country as he was responsible for initiation information technology and computer revolution.

“It was Rajiv Gandhi who gave voting rights to youngsters and strengthened the Panchayati Raj bodies by 73rd and 74th constitution amendment acts,’’ he said.

Title: Higher edu dept to shif subject teachers with no students
Article:
The higher education department would shift subject teachers from the colleges having no students to other colleges. This decision was taken in a meeting of the officials of the higher education department in the Vidhan Sabha on Friday.

The meeting was chaired by the state minister for cooperatives, protocol and higher education Dhan Singh Rawat.

The minister said that those teachers who are posted in the colleges where the students of their subject are not enrolled should be shifted to those colleges where they are required.

He also directed that pending works related to 19 colleges of the state should be completed before March 31, 2020.

In this regard, the minister directed the secretary, higher education to convene a meeting of the Principals of the colleges, planning department and finance department. On the order of Uttarakhand High Court (HC) which has paved the way for appointment of assistant professors on 877 posts, the minister said that the department would soon appoint selected candidates on these posts.

It is pertinent to mention here that on the requisition of the higher education department, the Uttarakhand Public Service Commission had started the process of recruitment on 877 posts of assistant professors in the government colleges of the state. The process was however halted when some aspirants challenged the recruitment process on the basis that the University Grants Commission (UGC) regulations are not being followed in it. The HC on Thursday removed the stay on the recruitment process. The meeting was attended by secretary higher education Ashok Kumar, joint secretary M N Semwal, joint director higher education Kumkum Rautela and others.

Title: Adopt and develop one village each: Guv tells universities
Article:
The Governor of Uttarakhand Baby Rani Maurya has asked the universities of the state to adopt and develop one village. She was addressing a meeting of Vice Chancellors (VC) of the universities at Raj Bhawan.

In the meeting, the governor directed that all the 11 state universities should develop one village each. She said that standard of drinking water, sanitation, education, livelihood and self employment opportunities should get improved in these smart villages. She said that she personally would inspect developmental works in these villages randomly.

The Governor directed that agriculture and technological universities should work on the “lab to laboratory transfer” policy seriously. “Universities should transfer the new techniques and research to the villages so that rural economy may be strengthened and become prosperous,’’ she said. She said that the universities should fill all the teaching and non teaching vacancies along with backlog vacancies soon. Governor said that roaster system should be followed in the process of recruitment. She directed that the inter university sports competitions should get re started. It was decided that the Kumaun University would host the inter university sports competition this year. The Governor also emphasised that the universities must sort out all affiliation related cases soon. She added that strict action should be taken against the colleges which are delaying the award of degrees the students.

In the meeting she was informed that most of the universities of state have implemented the ‘Digi Locker system’ for providing certificates and degrees. The Governor directed the left out universities to ensure that the 'Digi locker system is implemented. She also directed the VCs for organising convocations every year. The Governor asked the universities to improve the outcomes on various parameters and provide information of the research works they are undertaking, the number of patents they have got and improve ranking at national and international level.

The meeting was attended by state minister for higher education Dhan Singh Rawat, additional Chief Secretary (ACS), Om Prakash, Principal Secretary Anand Bardhan, Secretary R Meenakshi Sundaram, Secretary to Governor, Ramesh Kumar Sudhanshu, Secretaries, Sowjanya, Pankaj Kumar Pandey and all the Vice Chancellors of State Universities.

Title: ‘Dogs’ birth control drive in city a failure’
Article:
The Animal Birth Control (ABC) Dogs programme, which has been undertaken in the BMC area for the last 15 years jointly by the BMC and the Sahid Nagar Veterinary clinic, looks to be an unsuccessful drive.

This is evident from the fact that many dogs are dying in accidents in the city every day. The stray dog population has risen alarmingly.

“We are getting daily calls from public about the death of puppies, dogs due to accident in different manner. Due to over population, the man-animal conflict is mounting. People are also killing dogs and puppies by beating, kicking, overriding with an idea that they are dangerous for them. This is happening only due to failure of the programme,” said People for Animal secretary Jiban Ballav Das.

He said the ABC(Dogs) programme is violating laws in many ways. Though the BMC Commissioner and Secretaries of the Urban Development and Fisheries and Animal Resources Department have been appraised many times, nobody has taken the issue seriously.

“The dogs taken for sterilisation are not being given proper post operation care and food for which many dogs are also dying,” he said.

Claiming that the concerned officer came under a departmental inquiry for serious lapses, Das said there are many factors for the failure of the programme.

He demanded that the ABC (Dogs) programme be brought under the 5T initiative for its successful implementation and transparency.

“I have written to 5T Secretary VK Pandian requesting him to bring the ABC (Dogs) programme under the 5T initiative,” Das said.

Title: NHRC asks State Govt for report in 4 weeks
Article:
The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has sought an action-taken report (ATR) from the Chief Secretary on sexual exploitation of minor girls, especially those belonging to SC and ST communities, in Odisha.

Acting on a petition filed by rights activist and lawyer Radhakanta Tripathy, the NHRC has sought the report within four weeks. In his petition Tripathy cited incidents in which many minor school students who got pregnant in the SC and ST Schools in 2018 and 2019.

On March 2015, basic human rights of 17 sexually harassed girls were violated as the then SC & ST Development Minister Lal Bihari Himirika had disclosed their names and addresses in the State Assembly.

The State runs more than 1,000 ashram or sevashram schools and they together teach more than three lakh students. Most of these students stay in these hostels free of cost.

Tripathy alleged that the failure of the SC and ST Development, School and Mass Education and Women and Child Development Departments and the State police in acting on the issue and checking crimes against minor girls, especially the schoolchildren, amounts to serious violation of human rights. No health checkup of the students is another serious issue, Tripathy alleged.

Tripathy also requested the NHRC to monitor preventive and punitive actions taken by the State authorities, including health officials, and to take legal action against the errant officials, elected representatives, culprits. He urged the commission to ask the Government to pay a compensation of Rs 10 lakh to each victim under the Nirbhaya Scheme or under the Victim Compensation Scheme, POCSO Act, and rehabilitate all the victims.

The NHRC in its order warned the Chief Secretary that it would be constrained to ask for personal appearance of the concerned authorities it the report is not received within the stipulated time of four weeks.

Title: Masked hoodlums ransack shops in city
Article:
Panic gripped the Market Building area in the city on Friday evening when a group of hooligans wearing masks went on a rampage ransacking many shops and attacking vendors.

According to reports, 20 to 25 armed miscreants arrived at the marketplace at around 6.30 pm and started vandalising makeshift food and stationary item stalls. They also thrashed several vendors before fleeing the spot.

Some injured shopkeepers were admitted to the Capital Hospital.

Though the reason behind the attack was yet to be ascertained, it was suspected that the incident might have been a fallout of a dispute between a vendor and a buyer which had taken place on Thursday.

“A heated exchange of words took place between me and a customer yesterday when he was buying some items from my shop. Though the matter was settled at the Capital police station, I suspect involvement of the customer and his associates in the attack,” the vendor said.

Police were deployed at the spot to avert any further untoward incident while efforts were on by cops to identify and nab the assailants.

Title: ‘Plaint unlikely to affect Dhullu’s membership’
Article:
The demand for cancelling the membership of Baghmara legislator Dhullu Mahto from Assembly has gained momentum after former Bokaro Industrial Area Development Authority (BIADA) chairman and social activist Bijay Kumar Jha submitted an application to Jharkhand Assembly Speaker Ravindra Nath Mahto to take action in this connection. Jha citing the decision of the Constitution Bench of five judges of the Supreme Court canceling the election of a Kerala legislator has stated that the same can be done with Mahto too.

Jha, in his application, has stated that Mahto in different cases has been sentenced to jail term upto 72 months. As per Jha’s application since the Supreme Court has cancelled an MLA's election in a Kerala case, Dhullu Mahato's membership should end on the same basis. He has said that if any person is sentenced to more than two years in any case, then he is not eligible to contest elections. Jha has also attached a copy of the Supreme Court's decision against Kerala MLA P Jayarajan in the year 2005.

Jha has also drawn the attention of Speaker to the provision of section 8 (3) of the Representation of People Act, 1951, which states that while fixing the 'minimum two years' sentence, the entire sentence given to the person will be seen to be added. In this way, Dhullu Mahto may not have been sentenced to more than two years in one case, but the punishment awarded to him in different cases is 72 months i.e. 6 years which means that he is not eligible to contest elections or the membership should be canceled.

However, legal experts claim that it is not easy for Assembly to terminate the membership of Mahto as he is no serving jail term of three or more than three years in a single case. Ranchi High Court senior advocate, PPN Roy said, “If a person (lawmaker) is sentenced to imprisonment for a period less than three years in a single case than in no case his membership will be terminated. Also the entire sentence given to the person in different cases will not be added in deciding the membership of the person.”

Mahto is facing serious charges of extorting money from labourers and hard coke factory owners, is three term MLA representing Baghmara Assembly seat.

Title: Opp spreading lies about CAA: Das
Article:
The Bharatiya Janata Party is the only party that talks about national interest. Many divisive powers are trying to break the country. Therefore, the responsibility of the Bharatiya Janata Party workers increases. Opposition party leaders are misleading people about the Citizenship Amendment Act due to vote bank politics. People of Muslim community are being misled,” former Chief Minister Raghuvar Das said at Bihar Sharif addressing BJP workers as part of Bharatiya Janata Party's Jan Jagran Abhiyan on Citizenship Amendment Act.

He said that people of any caste and religion living in India will not be affected by this law. “The Citizenship Amendment Act will give Indian citizenship to the oppressed people of Hindu, Sikh, Christian, Persian, Buddhist, Jainism living in neighbouring countries Pakistan, Afghanistan, Bangladesh. This law has been brought in these Islamic countries to give asylum to India due to persecution of minority on the basis of religion,” he added.

Das said that this was also mentioned in the BJP's resolution letter. The BJP knows to fulfill its resolve. But, the people of the Opposition party are working to spread hatred in the country due to cheap politics. Keeping this in mind, the BJP leadership has launched a mass awareness campaign across the country. With the help of campaign, people are helping to clear the confusion. People are getting very good support, said the former CM.

Earlier, Das launched a public awareness campaign in the area. Under this, people went door to door and gave information related to the Citizen Amendment Act. BJP District President of Nalanda, Prof. Ram Sagar Singh, District In-charge Dr. Ram Sagar Singh, Senior BJP leader Achal Sinha, General Secretary Rajeshwar Singh, District Secretary Shailendra Kumar, Senior BJP Leaders, Divisional President, Mahila Morcha officials including a large number of dignitaries were present on the occasion.

Title: In briefs
Article:
IWCS celebrates Inner Wheel Day

The Inner Wheel Club of Swarnrekha,Ranchi celebrated the International Inner Wheel Day in a great way, living up to the Inner Wheel motto of service & friendship. As many as 20 members of the club under the leadership of president Debjani Sanyal and in a friendly and amicable spirit executed charitable projects at the "Mother Ziramani Teacher's Training College", Gunja, Ormanjhi and at "Govt. Middle School", Chakla, Ormanjhi and also at Gunja village. The members of the Club distributed Blankets, Sanitary Napkins, Chocolates, Slippers and Badminton Rackets. The club also planted 50 saplings to promote and spread the importance of planting trees to save our environment and save the planet.

Ishita Purwar selected for King’s College

Ishita Purwar, student of class XII of DPS Ranchi has brought laurels to the school by being selected for the King’s College London, University of London. She had applied to this college through the UCAS App. She has been offered an undergraduate course in Economics and Management. King's College London is one of the oldest and most prestigious colleges in England ranked 33rd in the world (QS World University Rankings 2020). It is a leading research university and has an outstanding reputation for world-class teaching and cutting-edge research. Earlier also, she was offered a place from the University of Manchester, University of Bath (UK) and University of Edinburgh.

SAIL to organise competitions

On the occasion of the 9th National Safety Day, SAIL Safety Organization has organized a painting and extempore competition for school students and students of Ranchi, which is to be held on January 23 at 9:30 AM to 12:30 PM at JVM Shyamali. The subject of painting will be road safety, safety in school and home and instilling good safety habits in children since childhood. The competition is in three groups, classes 3 to 5, classes 4 to 6 and classes 9 to 12. Each school can send a maximum of 2 participants per group. The last date for application is 18th January. Interested school management can contact 8986880305.

AVTM machines by RRD

Two Automatic Ticket Vending Machines were installed at Jhalda Railway Station by Ranchi Railway Division and an awareness campaign was also run for the same. Ranchi, Hatia, Muri and other stations under RRD have the AVTMs installed earlier. Commercial inspector Sukhdev Rakshit and Ugrasen Kumar alongwith Reservation observer Anil Kumar Singh and other were present on the occasion.

DPS students in Mind Wars TV Show

Anshuman Pandey (Class IX) and Ayaan Arif (Class VI) have been selected to represent Delhi Public School Ranchi in the Mind Wars TV Show. Shooting for the TV Show will be organised in Jaipur between 15th and 17th January 2020. Zee Entertainment Enterprises (ZEE) has launched one of the world’s largest quiz program titled ‘Mind Wars’ for school students across India. Mind Wars is a quiz contest providing a comprehensive knowledge acceleration program for students from grade 6th to 10th to be hosted on a multi-platform ecosystem.

CRE programme at Deepshikha

A 3-day CRE programme is being organised at Deepshikha, Child Development and Mental Health Institute on ‘Music, dance and play’. The programme began on Friday with the welcome speech of Pramod Kumar, while Anuradha Vats discussed on feeling ans expressions of music, dance and play. Chief speaker of the programme Dr Alok Kumar Bhuvan, Director of Manovikas Charitable Trust, Delhi presented his research in the programme on the topic ‘Vedic dance and music’. Bhuvan has presented his paper in UNESCO also. The programmeis related to Indian rehabilitation Council, where 30 participants from Bihar and Jharkhand are taking part.

News marathon by T-Break

T-Break is the first mobile news application in its own right that briefs all the important news from all over the world in just 400 letters with the tag line 'Chhoti Hi Kafi Hai'. Factual news can be seen on the T -Break app. All news published on the app is sourced from completely unbiased and transparent sources. The category of video content is also available on this extraordinary app released in both Hindi and English language. Moreover, the trending news running on social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube can also be seen directly through this app. By going to options like My Feed or My Feed section on T-Break, you can enjoy the news of your choice from the categories like politics, sports, entertainment, Business, Feature, etc.

Goonj, TikTok come together

Goonj, one of award-winning voluntary organisations and short video platform TikTok have come together to launch an in-app winter contribution challenge called #SpreadTheWarmth. Goonj has been highlighting the issues faced by the less fortunate who don’t have adequate winter clothes and therefore, has joined forces with TikTok, to raise awareness among people to contribute their new/old but usable woolens during one of the coldest winters in India in decades. The #SpreadTheWarmth campaign that went live on January 1, 2020, encourages TikTok users to create videos while making contributions within their communities and helping the less fortunate to tackle a severe winter season. Since its launch on TikTok, the hashtag has garnered over 575 million video views and many new community initiatives have come up to showcase the spirit of giving.

BoI celebrates World Hindi Day

World Hindi Day was celebrated at ‘Yogada Satsang Kanya Vidyalaya’, Ranchi on Friday under the aegis of Bank of India, Ranchi Zone. The children were made aware about the basic duties and rights of citizens mentioned in the Constitution as well as the Official Language Hindi. They were made aware about the schedules of the general as well as general banking, education loans, fraud and measures to avoid it etc. About 120 learners and 10 teachers participated in the event. On behalf of Bank of India, Rajbhasha Officer Sanjay Kumar Sen and Principal Ratnamala from school management were present in the event.

Title: Congress seeks ‘Chhapaak’ to be tax free in Jharkhand
Article:
Taking cue from other Congress ruled States, Jharkhand Pradesh Congress Committee (JPCC) on Friday demanded that Dipika Padukone starrer ‘Chhapaak’ should be made tax free in the State. The Meghna Guljar directed movie facing controversy had a nationwide release on Friday.

All three Congress ruled states - Chief Minister Kamal Nath led Madhya Pradesh Government, Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel led Chhattisgarh Government and Ashok Gehlot led Rajasthan Government - announced the movie to be tax free in their respective states before the release of the movie.

JPCC Working president, Rajesh Thakur said that the movie is about victims of acid attacks and such kinds of movies should be watched by more and more audiences because such kinds of movies have social impact. “This is not matter of controversy that Padukone visited Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), where she stood in solidarity with the students injured in last week’s vicious mob attacks that left around 35 students injured,” he added.

“Such kind of film gives social impacts on various social menaces like acid attacks and violence against women. Governments should promote such kinds of film across the country to eradicate such kinds of activity from society. Only supporting the injured students should not be issue to discourage movie like ‘Chhapaak’. Activist of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthy Parisad (ABVP) are opposing the movie is not appropriate. By doing this they are encouraging incident like Acid Attacks,” said Thakur.

Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Punjab also made arrangement for special screening of movie ‘Chhapaak’ in Zirkapur for victim of acid attack. Samajwadi Party (SP) National president and former Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh (UP), Akhilesh Yadav also made arrangement for the party workers to watch the movie on its screening on Friday. He himself will watch the movie on its screening along with the party workers.

“Now a day people don’t have issues to talk on like debilitating economy and eradicating jobs, they only talks on, such kinds of controversies raised to divert people’s attention from basic issues like education, health and others,” said Thakur.

Title: JPA wants Govt intervention in violence against cops
Article:
The Jharkhand Police Association (JPA) has sought Government’s intervention in addressing the recent spurt in incidents of mob attacks on police forces. An official communiqué from JPA – in the wake of a recent attack on a police team in Pakur – on Friday urged the Government to take notice of the incident and keep any form of direct or indirect political influence from affecting police investigation.

“We request the Government to take decisive measures in addressing the disturbing trend of mob attacks on police teams and take stringent actions against the people involved in instigating innocent villagers to take up arms against the police,” said the communiqué from JPA. “Any political party involved in such practices, too, should not be allowed to influence police investigation either directly or indirectly,” the communiqué added.

On Tuesday, a police team was thrashed by an infuriated mob under Littipara Police Station in Pakur during the course of an arresting. The team had visited a place near Littipara More to arrest one Babudhan Marandi on charges of looting, when he cried for help and fellow villagers subsequently attacked the police team. The mob also torched a police vehicle and caused severe injuries to an Assistant Sub Inspector, Ramesh Kumar Singh.

Mob violence has emerged as one of the major concerns of the Government in Jharkhand lately. According to figures with the State police, as many as 39 cases of mob lynching have been reported in Jharkhand so far. And at least 51 people have been convicted in four cases of mob lynching reported in Jharkhand, say police records. In the recent past, police too have fallen prey to the wrath of mobs in Jharkhand. Several cops were held captive and allegedly thrashed during the Pathalgadi movement in Khunti. Besides, on many instances, villagers had turned hostile during arresting, police said.

“We condemn all forms of violence against policemen. Such attacks have to stop. How will we undertake our responsibilities and do our duties when such attacks are not dealt with sternly?” said Yogendra Singh, Secretary, JPA.

Title: Governor, Former CM, Mayor pay tribute to Justice Shahdeo
Article:
Jharkhand Governor, Droupadi Murmu, former Chief Minister Raghubar Das, Ranchi Mayor Asha Lakra among a number of eminent personalities of the State paid tributes to Late Justice LPN Shahdeo on the eighth death anniversary of one of the pioneers of separate Jharkhand movement here on Friday.

Speaking on the occasion Das said that Justice Shahdeo was a frontline warrior of the separate Jharkhand movement. “His role in the formation of the State of Jharkhand can never be forgotten. Jharkhand movement was motivated by his intellectual energy,” he added.

The tribute programme started with Justice Shahdeo’s wife Prabha Shahdeo garlanding on his portrait. Justice Shahdeo’s Eldest daughter Shilpi Singh Deo, , son Pratul Shahdeo, daughter-in-law Vidya Jha Shahdeo, granddaughter Shambhavi, grandson Shaurya Pratap were also present on the occasion.

In his condolence message, the first Chief Minister of Jharkhand, Babulal Marandi, said that the leading role of Justice Shahdeo in the separate Jharkhand movement cannot be forgotten. Paying tribute on the Chowk, Rajya Sabha MP, Sameer Oraon described Justice Shahdeo as the son of the soil of Jharkhand and said that he was the hero of the last battle of Jharkhand.

Paying tribute to Justice Shahdeo, Ranchi Mayor Asha Lakra said that when

Justice Shahdeo was arrested in the course of separate Jharkhand movement, it had happened in the first time in the history of the Country that a former High Court judge was arrested during any movement.

A strong supporter for the formation of a separate State of Jharkhand, Late Justice LPN Shahdeo was also the first former High Court Judge to be arrested in 1998-99 for leading the agitation for a separate State.

It was then that BJP, JMM, AJSU, Congress- a total of 16 political parties came together to start the movement and formed the ‘All Party Separate State Formation Committee’. Coming from a non political background, Justice Shahdeo was elected as the convener of the committee.

Justice Shahdeo was always a strong supporter of a separate State and upon retiring from the High Court in 1992 he continued to support the movement through his writings in local newspapers and public forums.

Justice Shahdeo was born on January 3, 1930 in Kaamta village of Latehar district. He did his primary education in a Government school and completed his matriculation from Balkrishna High School, Ranchi. On completing his graduation from Ranchi College, Shahdeo got his law degree in 1954 and started his practice at the Ranchi Civil Court.

It was in 1958 that he joined judicial services and got his first posting as a Munsif Magistrate in Hazaribagh.

In 1989 he became the district and session judge in Dhanbad. From 1986 to 1992, he was the judge at Patna High Court’s Ranchi bench.

Among those who paid tribute on this occasion, Jharkhand Pradesh BJP Organization Minister Dharmapal Singh, Ranchi University Vice Chancellor Dr Ramesh Pandey, MLA Samri Lal, Deputy Mayor Sanjeev Vijayvargiya, Tribal and Regional Language Department Head Dr Hari Uraon, Veteran agitator Dr Bhuvaneswar Anuj, Lallan Singh, BJP Vice President Professor Aditya Sahu, Subodh Singh Guddu and others.

Title: Various plans announced in MCD board meet
Article:
Dehradun mayor Sunil Uniyal 'Gama' made some major announcements during the board meeting of the Municipal Corporation of Dehradun (MCD). He announced that the newly created wards in suburban and rural areas will have a budget of Rs 15 lakh whereas the city wards will get Rs 10 lakh for development works.

He also announced that widows will be given relaxation in house tax while leprosy patients will not have to pay house tax at all. Further, the board also passed proposals to allocate land to the state government for building of Sanya Dham and setting up a Rs five crore fixed deposit to facilitate payment of wages of the sanitation workers.

Talking about increasing the MCD’s source of income, he stated that the corporation will build some hotels, petrol pump and gas agencies after finalising land for these projects. Such endeavours will help to make the corporation financially more secure.

For public welfare, a 100-bed hospital and open gyms will be built in all the wards besides the opening of Skill Development Centre where youth can learn new skills and can get new opportunities. The plan for the construction of a sports academy will be executed too to promote sports among the youngsters of Doon.

As councillors said that information boards on construction sites are not that noticeable, it was decided that from now on the boards will comprise of red letters on a yellow background. Councillors of almost every ward put their issues before the house.

The most common issues of the councillors were ill-managed and open garbage bins, wandering stray cattle, monkey menace in the suburban and rural areas, lack of public toilets and insufficient number of sanitation workers.

Many proposals were also kept on hold in the meeting like the relaxation on property tax on the properties of Shri Guru Ram Rai Education Mission.

However the proposal of changing the names of Saharanpur Chowk to Teerthankar Bhagwan Mahavir Chowk, Darshini Gate to Shri Guru Ram Rai Darshini Gate and Laalpul Chowk to Shri Mahant Indiresh Chowk were passed by the board.

Another important issue raised by the board members was the large sums of money demanded by eunuchs from citizens on special occasions. The councillors demanded that a sum be fixed for this purpose but this was rejected.

The councillors demanded that fixed amounts be set for eunuchs so that they don’t demand more money forcing people to pay more than they can actually afford.

However, the mayor said that a committee will be formed to take a decision on this. The eunuchs will also be consulted before a decision is taken in this matter so that they do not feel as if they have been treated unfairly. During deliberation on the level of sanitation and lack of sanitation workers, the board decided to set up an annual FD of Rs five crore.

The annul interest from this will be used to pay the wages of sanitation workers. Additionally, approval was also granted for increasing the number of sanitation workers allocated for the new wards in suburban and rural areas.The board also passed the proposal for transferring municipal land near Canal Road to the state government for building Sanya Dham to honour the martyrs of Uttarakhand. In addition, Shaheed Dwaar will also be constructed to commemorate the valour of martyrs.

In another decision expected to help in improving the level of sanitation in the city, the board passed the proposal for penalising people who throw trash in public places.

The mayor said that this will make people more aware of cleanliness and a special authority will help to do the task efficiently.

However, the municipal corporation will make sure that no misuse of power is indulged in by the organisation to which the task of penalising is handed over.

He also suggested that the councillors should take out a mini-rally every fifteen days with the school students to spread awareness regarding cleanliness and hygiene.

Title: Two drones recovered, 3 Pak handlers held
Article:
Punjab Police on Friday seized two highly sophisticated Chinese-made drones used for smuggling drugs from Pakistan. The seizures, from Modhe village in Amritsar and another from Karnal in Haryana, were made after the Police arrested three Pak handlers, including a serving Army soldier and two drug smugglers belonging to a narco-terror module.

Announcing this, the state DGP Dinkar Gupta said that the module is involved in smuggling of weapons and narcotics across the border, and the seizures were the result of targeted and intelligence-led search operations.

Along with the two drones, the police has also recovered 12 drone batteries, custom-made drone containers, two walkie-talkie sets, Rs 6.22 lakh in cash, one i20 car, believed to be proceeds of drugs, and the magazine of an INSAS rifle.

The three arrested were identified as Dharminder Singh from Dhanoa Khurd village in Amritsar, Rahul Chauhan of Ambala Cantt in Haryana, and Balkar Singh of Kalas village in Amritsar (Rural).

While Dharminder Singh was arrested from Hardo Rattan village, about 3 km from the India-Pakistan border, Balkar Singh had been lodged in Amritsar Jail in a NDPS case and was brought on production warrant.

Haryana’s Chauhan, an army man, was reportedly involved in procuring and supplying drones and training to cross-border smugglers.

DGP said that the two members of the narco-terror module were still absconding and efforts were on to nab them. Further investigations were underway to ascertain details about the accused ties with terrorist outfits, radicals, drug smugglers and other anti-national elements, he added.

Gupta said that the drones, capable of travelling two to three kms on either side of the border, were reportedly being launched from the Indian side to fly into Pakistan to pick up payloads of narcotics. They had apparently already conducted four to five sorties, he added.

“This is the first documented case where drones have been used to smuggle narcotics,” said the DGP while addressing the media along with ADGP (Internal Security) RN Dhoke, IG Border Range SPS Parmar, and Tarn Taran SSP Dhruv Dhaiya.

“Since August, there are in all three documented cases of drones bringing supply. Earlier, the drones carried the weapons, but this is the first documented case of drone carrying narcotics,” said the DGP adding that no drugs had yet been recovered.

According to the DGP, the module members had revealed that they were involved in cross-border smuggling of drugs and weapons over drones over the past few months. Certain Pakistan-based drug smugglers, who were sending the drugs and weapons from across the border in Pakistan, had also come to notice, he added.

Preliminary investigations had confirmed that Rahul Chauhan was directly involved in operating drone sorties across the border for picking up heroin as well as weapons from Pakistan, along with his associates in India and Pakistan.

“He and his accomplices were in direct contact with Pakistani smugglers on encrypted OTT platforms,” said the DGP, adding that the plan was to send one of the walkie-talkie sets across the border to Pakistan to facilitate two-way communication.

“The first drone, a Chinese made DJI INSPIRE 2 drone (Quadcopter) was recovered from an abandoned government Dispensary building in Modhe village in Amritsar (Rural), where it had been hidden by Dharminder Singh and his associate drug smugglers.

The second drone, a Chinese made DJI MATRICE 600 PRO (Hexacopter), was recovered from a house in Karnal (Haryana) on the disclosures of Rahul Chauhan.

Gupta said that the Punjab Police had launched a covert operation to ensure close monitoring and checking of the border areas in view of the recent influx of weapons and drugs across the border through drones as well as other means.

“Special nakas had been set up in the border areas as part of these special operations to focus on suspicious activities on the border as well as the possible collusion among drug and weapon smugglers, cross-border gun-runners, radicals etc,” he said.

It was during this special operation that the police gathered inputs that one Balkar Singh, who was lodged in Amritsar Jail in a NDPS case, was smuggling drugs and weapons using drones, along with his associates.

Following such inputs, a case was registered at Police Station Gharinda of Amritsar (Rural) and special teams were formed of officers of the Amritsar (Rural) Police district to operationalise the intelligence leads, said the DGP.

The state police chief pointed that the Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh had already expressed concern over the recent drone activity along the border, which first came to light in August 2019 post abolition of Article 370, and had raised the issue with the central government, seeking close monitoring by central agencies and forces.

The Central Government has already issued SOPs for use of drones, which, with their ability to fly low without lights and their minimal engine noise, can also be used to target VIPs.

Title: in brief
Article:
Khajrana Ganesh Mandir in world book of records

Indore: The Khajrana Ganesh Mandir Indore is now in world book of records. On 1 January 2020, a total of 8,35,917 devotees worshipped and prayed in Khajrana Ganesh Temple. World book of records presented a listing certificate on the feet of lord Ganesha at Khajrana Ganesh Mandir.

The team representing world book of records comprising Madhur Tamele, Pradeep Mihsra, Sanjay Panjvani, Ashish Mishra were present. From the Khajrana Ganesh Temple management committee B L Kansat, J S Mishra Mohan Bhatt, Vinit Bhatt, Sunil Patidar, Govind Patidar, Rajesh Verma and all other priests of Khajrana Ganesh Mandir were present.

6,016 cases of wrong billing resolved in state

Bhopal: As many as 6,016 cases of wrong billing were resolved in the State in the month of December by committees, constituted to settle the incorrect bills. A total 2,317 cases of Purva Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company, 1,124 cases of Madhya Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company and 2575 cases of Pashchim Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company were resolved. On the instructions of the Minister for Energy Priyavrat Singh, electricity distribution centre wise committees were constituted in August last. Singh informed that total 1,210 committees were formed in the work area of all the 3 power distribution companies. In this, 330 committees in Madhya Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company, 448 in Purva Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company and 432 in Pashchim Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company have been constituted.

Min: Journo’s suggestions will be included

Bhopal: Public Relations Minister PC Sharma said in a meeting of journalists that their suggestions, regarding the construction of the media centre, at Malviya Nagar, Bhopal, will be included. Journalists gave important suggestions regarding the media centre at the meeting.

He said that the process of construction of the new Patrakar Bhawan (Media Centre) has been started as per the instructions of Chief Minister Kamal Nath. Shri Sharma said that construction work will be started soon.

Principal Secretary Public Relations Sanjay Kumar Shukla said that this meeting is in connection with the construction of Patrakar Bhawan. He informed that separate suggestions will be taken regarding the operation of the Patrakar Bhawan. Commissioner Public Relations P Narhari gave information about the outline of the proposed Patrakar Bhawan (Media Centre).

On this occasion, Architect Ajay Kataria gave a power point presentation regarding the design of the proposed media centre. Director Public Relations Om Prakash Shrivastava and other officials were present.

Title: 11 booked for assaulting 4 people
Article:
Habibganj police has booked eleven persons charged with assaulting four men after they entered a violent clash at Shayamal Nagar in the night on Thursday.

Panic prevailed at Shayamal Nagar area after two groups entered a violent clash in which four persons were injured.

In the initial investigation, police found that the victim, Ajay Batham, had a fight with his neigbour two days ago and to settle the score, his neighbour Rahul, Ashish, Chotu, Rashid, Uttam, Deepak, Jitendra and four others attacked Ajay and his friends with wooden sticks and iron rods.

Three persons, identified as Ratan Singh, Shaikh Aziz and Vinod, sustained major injuries.

The injured were rushed to nearby hospital where their condition is reportedly stable. Police are probing the case from all angles.

Police said that the accused created panic for over an hour during which they assaulted several persons of the locality and later escaped.

Based on the complaint, police have registered a case against the accused who are absconding.

Police have detained few suspects in this connection.

Title: Art camp of clay toys on display at MP State Tribal Museum
Article:
An art camp of clay toys is being held at Madhya Pradesh State Tribal Museum. It began here from Friday.

The camp was held by Tribal Folk Arts and Languages Development Academy, Madhya Pradesh Culture Council, Bhopal. Traditional artisans from Uttar Pradesh, Odisha, Rajasthan, West Bengal and Chhattisgarh are participating in the 10-day craft camp from other guest states including the State of Madhya Pradesh.

Rajesh Prasad Mishra, the director of the museum inaugurated the camp by lighting the lamp and welcoming all the artists with flowers.

Toys are the most important part of children's lives. Toys develop the imagination of the senses of children and on learning the usefulness of which, the child combines many things and creates new ones.

The tradition of earthen toys has been in India for many years, with the changing times, earthen toys have become extinct today.

The specialty of the clay toy is that it is a native toy crafted by the craftsmen here, in which all the colours including the dolls, dolls, king-queen, animal-birds are found in the shape of disguise. On the day of inauguration in the museum craft camp 'Aakar', craftsman Bhikham Prajapati of Mandla district of Madhya Pradesh prepared toys made of clay and clay.

He said that with the soil being fertile, he is very useful in craftsmanship, he has been engaged in craftsmanship for 25 years and often exhibits his craft in the camps of different states of the country.

He made elephant-horse and some animal-focused toys for children in the camp, along with all other traditional craftsmen who participated in the camp.

Title: Sisodia: Why is BJP scared of Chhapaak?
Article:
Hitting out at the BJP for being "easily intimidated by certain films that invoke a sense of social responsibility among people, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said it is very disgraceful to see people "getting intimidated" by films based on social issues.

Responding to a question on a BJP leader's call to boycott the Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak', Sisodia said ,"How can they be scared of a movie which is based on an acid attack victim?" he asked. "What kind of a political party is (BJP) if it is easily intimidated by and fears certain films that trigger a sense of social responsibilities among people and other important issues such as education," he said.

The senior AAP leader also hit out at the BJP for criticism over induction of five-time MLA Shoaib Iqbal into the party fold, saying if there are any criminals in the AAP, then put them behind bars. "The Delhi Police has been under the Centre for the past six years and if Iqbal has committed any crime then he should be arrested and put in jail," he said.

"If any AAP leader or anyone joining the party is a murder accused, then the BJP should be ashamed that he is free and outside jail. For six years, Delhi Police has been under you (BJP). Arrest him and put him in jail. If you can't run Delhi Police, then leave it. We will run it and show," he said, adding that and if there is any murderer in our party or your party, we will put him behind bars,"

Sisodia was responding to BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra's allegations that Iqbal has been convicted in several cases already and there is an unending list of grave offences under his names. Iqbal on Thursday joined the Aam Aadmi Party in presence of Chief Minister and AAP's national convenor Arvind Kejriwal.

The Deputy Chief Minister said the upcoming Assembly elections will be fought on the basis of the AAP Government's work. "The biggest achievement of the AAP Government is to induct quality invention to develop a positive attitude among students and parents," he said.

"This election is not just between two political parties but between two distinct visions for the future of our country. The AAP government has taken various initiatives to develop the education model with significant increase in the budget for education, establishing quality infrastructure and regular training to teachers, to improve the educational environment but the most important difference we have made is in the delivery of quality education," he said.

Talking about happiness curriculum launched for students in nursery to grade 8 of government schools, he said within a year of its launch that several private schools of Delhi also launched this curriculum. "The students told us that they have become more diligent and serious about their studies and have started experiencing life changing perspectives about themselves and the world," he said, adding that the second biggest educational intervention by the Kejriwal Government was the entrepreneurship mindset curriculum.

Sisodia also challenged the BJP to show one positive program they have designed for the development of education which has received a positive response from every section of society or other states and countries.

Title: AAP has dealt crushing blow to edu system: Puri
Article:
Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday alleged that the AAP has dealt a "crushing blow to the education system" and accused the Arvind Kejriwal dispensation of failing to reimburse 70 per cent of the education expense borne by the municipal corporations in Delhi.

Alleging that the civic body-run schools in Delhi are made to operate with only 57 per cent of the sanctioned teachers strength, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs minister took a swipe at the AAP Government's education model, saying, "They call this a success."

"It (AAP Government) has failed to reimburse Rs 3,941 cr to North MCD, Rs 569 cr to East MCD & Rs 223 cr to South MCD. As a result, the MCDs have been unable to pay salaries, seventh central pay commission arrears and other benefits to the teachers. The schools operate with only 57 per cent of teachers... They call this a success," Puri tweeted.

In a series of tweets, Puri said "it is appalling how Delhi govt claims success in the education system where none exists". "They have craftily built a fake narrative to divert attention from their failures. Pass percentages of students have steadily declined. They are imperilling the future of the children," Puri tweeted.

"Students are not able to realise their full potential because only 1/3rd of these schools offer science streams. What is even more alarming is that State Govt policies have forced several pvt schools to close down, leaving students without choice of science stream. Amongst secondary school students alone, it has come down from 99.4 per cent in 2014 to 68.9 per cent in 2018. Is this something they are proud of? Learning outcomes of classes 3,5 & 8 are nearly 10 percentage points lower than the national average & they call this a success story," he tweeted. All the three municipal corporations in Delhi are ruled by the BJP.

Title: ‘Exhibit of the Month’ in full swing at IGRMS
Article:
Under the popular museum series ‘Exhibit of the Month’ of Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya, a traditional object is displayed in the appearance for a whole month. The exhibit for the month of January, 2020 is “KHOH” (A traditional carrying basket of khasi Tribe).

Prof Sarit Kumar Chaudhuri, Director, IGRMS and Prof KK Basa (Tagore National Fellow) jointly inaugurated Exhibit of the month at Veethi Sankul indoor exhibition building. On this occasion DS Rao (Head of the Office, IGRMS), museum personnel and visitors were present in a large number. This exhibit of the month has been curated by P Shankara Rao (Assistant Keeper).

On this occasion, Rao told that, North-East region, a vital entity of great Indian land in spite of being geographically in the extreme corner of the country, greatly attracted to study the land, people and culture. Because the area is so different and distinct in terms of customs, traditions and values etc. Meghalaya the abode of clouds, home to wettest places in the world, the state is distributed three major hill areas i.e. Khasi hills, Garo hills and Jaintia hills. The present object chosen for exhibit of this month locally known as KHOH is a traditional Khasi bamboo carrying basket in East Khasi hills. The bamboo material culture of Khasi tribes’ present very attractive varieties of baskets ‘KHOH’ is one such example, which is extensively using both male and female in this region.

Bamboo is an important natural resource for the people of Meghalaya in general and more particular among the Khasis of East Khasi's of East Khasi hills of Meghalaya. This versatile basket is being made out of the outer hard portion of bamboo for the purpose of carrying materials such as fire wood, various farm products like ginger, yam, turmeric, tools and implements, pots and pans for washing, gourds to collect and carry drinking water, sand, bricks and seeds etc.

Title: Cong reaches people for party’s manifesto idea
Article:
Delhi Congress on Friday launched a campaign- "Dilli Ke Dil Ki Baat Congress Ke Saath' to get suggestions from people for the party's manifesto ahead of the Assembly polls on February 8. The campaign was launched by party leaders Shashi Tharoor, Delhi unit president Subhash Chopra and others.

Tharoor said the exercise, to be carried out through social media and other means, is a two-way process. The manifesto of the party should reflect needs of people, he said. "The Congress party will incorporate the suggestions of the common people in its manifesto for the Assembly elections as we believe that the time has come to consult the people for their direct participation. We have decided to issue a call to the citizens of Delhi to give their ideas for our manifesto for the 2020 Assembly elections," he said.

Under this campaign, Congress party has decided to have personal interaction with people ranging from women, youth, students, street vendors (rehri-patri walas), small and medium shopkeepers and traders, e-rickshaw and auto drivers to take their suggestions, Tharoor said, adding that the people have six platforms to communicate with the party to give their suggestions, which include WhatsApp number 91 9625777907, and missed call number 1800121555558 besides website www.dillikibaat.com and email: manifesto@dillikibaat.com.

Tharoor blamed the Modi Government for bringing the Citizenship Amendment Act as a deliberate attempt to divert people's attention from pressing issues like economic distress, unemployment and price rise. "The BJP was trying to create religious polarization in the country in a futile bid to derive political capital," he added. He asserted that the Congress will continue to oppose NRC, but will never support the slogans to divide the country.

Delhi Congress president Subhash Chopra slammed Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for not coming in support of students of Jamia Millia and JNU after they were injured following their peaceful protests. Party Chief Spokesperson Mukesh Sharma said that Delhi Congress will mount an aggressive campaign on social media to counter the propaganda and falsehood being spread by the BJP and Aam Aadmi Party.

Meanwhile, party leaders arranged a special screening of the movie for students in Daryaganj area here on Friday. "We bought all the 920 tickets of the 2-pm show. Around 800 students watched the film. Deepika stood with our students. Now it is our turn to support her," Congress leader Alka Lamba said.

Title: Raj Bala Malik is the new Mayor of Chandigarh
Article:
The Bharatiya Janta Party’s councilor Raj Bala Malik was on Friday elected as the new mayor of Chandigarh.

With the BJP enjoying majority in the Municipal Corporation General House, all three top posts including mayor, senior deputy mayor and deputy mayor went to the saffron party’s kitty.Malik defeated Congress mayoral nominee Gurbax Rawat through a secret ballot in the MC House. This will be Malik’s second term as mayor. Earlier, she had become mayor in 2012 as the Congress candidate.

The new mayor has replaced BJP’s Rajesh Kalia, who was elected on January 18 last year.

While there was a threat of cross-voting in the BJP camp, Malik managed to get support of all 22 party members.

The BJP has the majority in the 27-member of the MC House with 20 councillors while the Congress has five councillors. The BJP’s ally Shiromani Akali Dal also has one councilor while one vote is that of the Member Parliament Kirron Kher, who is the ex-officio member of the House.

In order to be elected as Mayor, a nominee needs 14 votes of the elected councillors.

The Chandigarh mayor holds a one-year term. This year, the mayoral chair was reserved for a woman candidate.

BJP’s councilor Ravi Kant Sharma was elected as senior deputy mayor and Jagtar Singh won the post of deputy mayor. They contested against Congress’ councillor Sheela Devi and Ravinder Gujral respectively.

MP Kirron Kher, who was present on the occasion, congratulated the newly elected members. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal also, through a Tweet, congratulated the Chandigarh BJP for the victory in mayoral polls.

After being elected to the top post, city’s mayor Raj Bala Malik while talking to the mediapersons said that all development works would be on her priority list. Focus would be on improving sanitation facilities in the city, she said.

Title: Haryana sees increase of 52 points in sex ratio
Article:
Male -Female sex ratio has improved by 52 points at birth during the last five years in Haryana, the State Government said on Friday.

As per the latest figures, the sex ratio of the State has increased from 871 girls for every 1,000 boys, in 2014 to 923 girls in 2019. Interestingly, the increase is even higher than the target set by the Government of India under ‘Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao’ (B3P) Guidelines.

Nodal Officer ‘Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao’ program, Rakesh Gupta said the State had gone up by leaps and bounds viz-a-viz the sex ratio. He said a total 518,725 births were registered during 2019 which includes 248,950 female births and 269,775 male births. He said that the majority of the districts which had a low sex ratio of below 900 for decades are now placed better with the sex ratio of 920+. "Two districts namely Panchkula and Ambala has attained the distinction of being 950+ (963,959 respectively), an ideal sex ratio at birth as per Public Health experts," Gupta said.

Gupta shared that Mahendragarh district of Haryana, which since decade was known to have the lowest sex ratio has also done wonders as the district gained a massive jump of 172 points to reach 917 in 2019, while, in 2014, the sex ratio of the district was even less than 800 (745). He said that in 2019, more than 2500 girls were saved in Mahendragarh district alone

The official said that during the last 5 years more than 730 FIRs were registered including 185 FIRs in neighbouring States of UP, Punjab, Delhi, Rajasthan and Uttrakhand and around 2000 culprits arrested in this crackdown against female foeticide. More than 200 prosecution cases under PC-PNDT Act are under trial in various courts against the offenders.

Apart from this the State Government also implemented ‘informer incentive scheme’ providing a reward of one lakh to the informer providing information about the sex determination in any part of State, which helped in exposing the gangs of criminals involved in this crime, Rakesh Gupta added.

Title: Haryana CM counters his HM, says past CMs also held CID charge
Article:
Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Friday said the CID remained under the CM’s charge during the terms of Bansi Lal and Devi Lal, an assertion that appears to counter the Home Minister’s claim over the department.

Khattar, however, sought to play down the row over who is in charge of the important Criminal Investigation Department (CID), the State Government’s intelligence gathering agency.

“It is not a big issue. It is a technical issue. We will find some way out in that technical issue and we have discussed this matter,” Khattar told reporters in Panchkula.

“It is not that this has happened for the first time. During the Chaudhary Devi Lal regime, the Home Ministry was given to Sampat Singh. At that time also, the CID and vigilance departments were held by the CM,” he said.

“Similarly, when Mani Ram Godara was made the home minister, Bansi Lal did the same thing,” he said, adding there were examples from some other States as well.

“There is a technical lacuna and this problem will be solved by removing that technical lacuna,” the Chief Minister said.

Earlier this week, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij had taken exception to two State Government websites that showed that the CID was held by Khattar.

"Governments are not run by websites. They are run by the rule of law," Vij had said on Wednesday.

Vij had asserted that according to the Business of Haryana Government (Allocation) Rules, 1974, the CID was part of the home department.He said this allocation can be changed, but cited procedure which he claimed must be

followed.

“The CM is supreme and, if he wishes, he can also change it. But for that, it has to be passed by the Cabinet and then later in Vidhan Sabha,” Vij had said.Later, the State Government removed the content showing the CID among the CM's portfolios from the websites.

The Haryana Chief Minister holds 17 different portfolios at present.

The home portfolio, along with other ministries like health and urban local bodies, was allotted to Anil Vij after the Bharatiya Janata Party-Jannayak Janta Party came to power last year.

Earlier, Vij had pulled up the CID for allegedly not sharing information sought by him on the Assembly polls and also marked a dissent note to the Chief Minister over the transfer of nine IPS officers without taking him into confidence.

Vij had also formed a three-member committee to suggest improvements in the CID’s functioning.

Title: Regional conference on environment inaugurated
Article:
A two-day regional conference was inaugurated in Gurugram on Friday at Haryana Institute of Public Administration (HIPA) in which more than 300 participants attended the Conference including Municipal Corporations of Delhi and Uttar Pradesh, regions of Haryana which fall under NCR and the policy makers from the Central and State Government.

On the first day of this conference, experts discussed the current state of environmental and solid waste management and the gaps in it. The various central and state government departments and experts deliberated on the issue.

At the inauguration of the Regional Conference, a member of NGT's Ghaggar Monitoring Committee, Dr. Babu Ram, welcomed the initiative of the Haryana Government and said that environmental pollution is a major issue these days. There is a need to take measures to keep a tab on the pollution-level. He said that the cooperation of common people is necessary for reducing environmental pollution. He also said that we should also pay attention to water management because currently 200 to 300 liters of water is being consumed by a person per day, which is more than the prescribed limit of 135 liters per day.

Haryana State Pollution Control Board Chairman Ashok Khetrapal said that solid waste management and environmental pollution is a matter of concern for every person. He said that if there are measures to conserve water, the pressure on sewage treatment plants will be reduced and these plants will be able to purify the water to its potential.

Chief Executive Officer of Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority V.S. Kundu, said that it is the responsibility of all of us to make the environment safe for future generations.

Principal Secretary of Urban Local Bodies, Haryana Mr. V Umashankar said earlier waste management was considered to be the responsibility of the urban local bodies and the government, but now it has become a liability of every citizen as it affects quality of life. Earlier, it was assumed to be the responsibility of the local bodies to dispose of garbage in residential areas, but now the common man is ready to pay for picking up garbage from the surrounding areas.

Title: ‘No democracy can flourish sans free press’
Article:
David J Ranz, Consul General, US Consulate General, Mumbai, visited Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Communication, Bhopal, for an interactive session with the students.

While addressing the gathering at Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Communication, Bhopal, David J Ranz, Consul General, US Consulate General asserted that journalism is a profession of courage and commitment and no democracy can flourish without the free press.

He commenced his talk with the famous quote of Third US President Thomas Jefferson in which he had stated “If I had to choose between Government without newspapers and newspapers without Government, I wouldn’t hesitate to choose the latter.”

‘In his speech David J Ranz asserted that journalism is a profession of courage and commitment and no democracy is possible without freedom of press as freedom of press lays foundation to nation’s core values. Talking about Indo-US relations, he said that Respect for sovereignty, transparency, and trade, values are the corner stone of this relationship. These geo-strategic partners have a lot in common in terms of cultural values and mutual interests for heading north in growth and development.

He also spoke about the strong role played by Indian Americans in every sector of US society and there critical role in bringing the two nations closer.

He also spoke about the current business environment in India. Multinational companies are repositioning their finances globally and India can take advantage of this once in a generation opportunity by ensuring a reliable investment environment.

He also encouraged Indian students to avail the opportunites to study in US universities by working with Education USA for information.

The programme was followed by an engaging question- answer session in which students raised various questions on global issues. On a question regarding climate change Ranz asserted that US cannot rectify this problem alone, unless countries like India and China step in. Answering a question on higher education he said that US has the best universities of the world where Indian students can pursue their higher studies.

Earlier, Deepak Tiwari, Vice Chancellor of the University welcomed the guest with shawl and shrifal and in his welcome speech reiterated that democracy and journalism are two sides of the same coin and without impartial journalism democracy cannot survive. He also discussed the future challenges in developing and maintaining International relations with other countries.

Title: Govt’s primary goal is to provide food to each needy, eligible family in State
Article:
The State Government’s primary goal is to provide food to each needy eligible family in the State. Under the provisions of National Food Security Act 2013, 5.46 crore beneficiaries in the State are being provided ration at a subsidized rate by the State Government. Moving ahead, 22,000 ration shops were added to Aadhaar-based ration distribution system (Ae-PDS) in Madhya Pradesh Government in October 2019.

With this arrangement, all such poor beneficiaries who move from one city to another in search of employment or for any other reason, can take their ration from any shop in that city from Ae-PDS. So far, 76.93 lakh families have availed benefit from this. It is a remarkable fact that the Central Government is also considering to implement this scheme.

The Government of Madhya Pradesh has already started it. Along with this, the “promises” with which the new government was formed in the state on December 17, 2018 are also being fulfilled with full commitment.

Madhya Pradesh Food Security Pulse Distribution Scheme has been implemented for the supply of protein and other nutrients in the food of the beneficiaries under the National Food Security Act, 2013, under which the rate of distribution of gram is fixed at Rs 27 per kg.

The eligibility is one kg per member and maximum four kg per family.

An allocation of 40,793 metric tonnes has been given to 117.47 lakh eligible families every month.

Distribution of one kg sugar per family every month at the rate of Rs 20 per kg has been started to 16 lakh 39 thousand 993 families identified under Antyodaya Anna Yojana as eligible families included under the National Food Security Act, 2013 from March, 2019 on which a grant at the rate of Rs 3,224 per tonne is being given by the state government.

Beneficiaries ineligible under the National Food Security Act, 2013, have been removed from the portal while benefits of the scheme have been given to eligible 1,65,438 new families included in the Act.

At present, 5.46 crore beneficiaries are being given the benefit of targeted public distribution system.

There is a provision to provide benefits to 5.46 crore persons, which is 75 per cent of the population, according to 2011 census under the National Food Security Act, 2013.

The estimated population of the year 2018 of Madhya Pradesh is 8.23 crore, 75 percent of which is 6.17 crore. Thus, foodgrains allocation is not being received for 71 lakh beneficiaries.

Only 66 percent of the present population, which is 9 percent less as per the Act are obtaining the benefits. The Government of India has been urged to allot additional foodgrain for these 71 lakh beneficiaries.

Title: “Jagdev Kankali” folk play in Kuchamani Khyal style staged
Article:
The “Jagdev Kankali” folk play in Kuchamani Khyal style was staged at the Madhya Pradedh State Tribal Museum on Friday.

The play was directed by Bansi Lal Khel (Rajasthan) under Abhinayan series of dramas.

Folk play is based on the narration of Lord Jagadev, the eldest son of King Udayadeep of Dharanagari. 'Nar Jagdev' is the son of the late queen of the king, the second wife of the king does not take care of his step son.

On the way to the palace, one day Goddess Kankali has to pass and seeing the child crying she takes care of the child as a maid. When the male Jagdev grows up, at the behest of the stepmother, the king expels him from the court and hands over the kingdom to Randhaval, the son of a second wife. Jagdev leaves that state and works in the court of King Jayachandra in Kannauj state.

The queen of Kannauj is troubled by the mistreatment of a demon named Chandrika Bhairava. When asked by which the king remains very sad, the king told the whole thing to Nar Jaidev. According to the King's order, the male Jagdev watches that night, Bhairava battles the demon in which the male Jagdev is victorious.

In this happiness, the king proposes marriage with his elder daughter to the male Jagdev. The demon, saddened by the defeat, is also a devotee of Mata Kankali and demands the death of male Jagdev from his mother.

She takes the form of a petitioner seeking alms, comes to the king's court.

The king misbehaves with them, then she teaches the king a lesson, while he asks for her head from the male Jaidev. Seeing the severed head, Bhairava is transformed and he asks goddess to revive him.

Title: Tiwari-headed 15-member poll panel formed
Article:
The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Friday announced 15-member election committee headed by State BJP president Manoj Tiwari for the Delhi Assembly elections. By appointing Tiwari as the head of the election committee, BJP Central leadership has made it amply clear that the party will contest assembly elections under the leadership of Tiwari.

The committee comprises of all the seven Lok Sabha members, including Tiwari. National office bearers Anil Jain, Dushyant Gautam and RP Singh, former Delhi BJP presidents Vijay Goel and Satish Upadhyay, organisation secretary Sidharthan, Delhi BJP Mahila Morcha president Punam Jha and leader of opposition (lop) Vijender Gupta are also members of the committee.

In the last week of December, the party had announced a poll management committee and 35 other panels for election-related works.

The BJP is pitching itself to wrest power from Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and it is not leaving any stone unturned to corner AAP. Tiwari had on Thursday declared that he will be asking 10 questions from Arvind Kejriwal on issues of governance.

Earlier in the day, BJP's working president JP Nadda held organisational meetings with party workers on Friday and said Delhi needs "development not advertisement". Nadda told party workers to conduct door-to-door campaigns to expose the lies of the APP government led by Arvind Kejriwal.

"We will go door-to-door in Delhi to expose the injustice done by the Kejriwal government to the people of Delhi, the lies spoken to them and the scams committed by the government," Nadda tweeted."Delhi needs development not advertisement," he said.

Sanjay Mayukh, media co-incharge of the party, said Nadda has been holding the organisational meeting with party workers since Friday morning and will continue till late in the night.

The state assembly constituencies where the meetings are scheduled to be held are Trinagar, Shalimar Bagh, Burari, Timarpur, Chandani Chowk and Babarpur.

The meetings are being held to take stock of the party's election preparedness and motivate the workers for the assembly polls, he said. Voting for the 70 seats of Delhi Assembly will take place on February 8 and the counting of votes will take place on February 11.

It may be noted that BJP president Amit Shah had held a meeting with party booth workers at Tal Katora stadium and had outlines party's strategy for the assembly election. Shah had then gone ahead and mate people in the national capital to talk to them and also tell them about the positive aspects of the Citizenship Amendment Act.

When asked about the party's preparation for the assembly elections to be held on February 8 of this year, a senior leader said that they are reaching out to every voter of Delhi to tell them about AAP government that did precious little and has been befooling the people.

Title: Kala-Gram to be built adjoining Bharat Bhavan
Article:
Kala-Gram (Art village) will be built on the land adjoining Bharat Bhavan. At the same time, a film on the life and activities of Patalkot will be produced under the town-based filmmaking project, so that this area could be highlighted at international level in terms of tourism. The decision was taken in a meeting of Bharat Bhavan Management held at Mantralaya under the Chairmanship of the Chief Minister Kamal Nath.

The Chief Minister said that Bharat Bhavan enjoys a reputation of centre of art activities at the international level. Special efforts should be made to make it more prosperous from the point of view of art, culture and literature. He said that various events should be conducted in Bharat Bhavan with artists and litterateurs with appropriate approach. Kamal Nath directed to prepare a time bound plan to realize the vision of Kala Gram.

The Chief Minister, Kamal Nath said that India is a country of different cultures. A festival focused on the North-Eastern States should also be organized to connect all cultures. He instructed to make a roadmap for the festival. The Chief Minister also asked to organize a special programme to connect the youth with the rich tradition of Indian art, culture and literature. He said that youth participation in the activities of Bharat Bhawan should also be ensured.

Nath directed to make the art decoration of Bharat Bhavan excellent. The Chief Minister expressed satisfaction over the activities held at the Bharat Bhavan and told to continue it.

Minister for Culture Vijayalaxmi Sadho said that as per the intention of the Chief Minister, art, literature and other activities of Indian culture will be expanded. The Trustee Secretary of Bharat Bhavan and Principal Secretary Culture Pankaj Raag briefed about the proposed programmes to be held at Bharat Bhavan. The Additional Chief Secretary KK Singh and Deputy Secretary Culture Pragya Awasthi were present at the meeting.

Title: Light drama and satire on increasing divorce staged
Article:
A light comedy-drama and satire on matters of increasing divorce in the society was beautifully staged on Friday. The play 'Pati Patni aur Court' was performed leaving an impactful message for the audience. It was staged at Kalarang Theatre Festival.

Written and directed by Ashish Shrivastava, the play was performed beautifully by Chetna Cultural and Social Welfare Society, Bhopal.

The play revolves around the messy relationship between a young couple. It highlights about various shades not only of their relationship, but also of their individual personalities.

While the couple tackles with different hardships and hurdles of their married life, a face of society is also shown to the audience.

The judge of the court signifies the society and how the judge reacts to their divorce emphasized over the action that should be taken in such situations.

In a family court, a beautiful couple comes to the judge for divorce and in front of the same judge, they got married in the marriage court 1 year ago. The Judge feels very sad to see these husband and wife in the divorce court.

Due to not having sufficient reason for divorce, the Judge orders both husband and wife to stay together for one month (cooling-off period) and during this one month period the Judge tries to bring both husband and wife back to each other.

The play was brilliantly performed by the artists. At some scenes, the audience laughed out loud and at some, they were left to think upon this serious issue.

Title: University has agreed to meet students' demands, save expulsion of V-C: MHRD
Article:
After a week of deliberations aimed at diffusing tension between students and administration of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) not yielding any desired result, the MHRD Ministry on Friday stated that the university has agreed to meet all the demands of the students' representatives, except for their demand of resignation of Vice Chancellor Professor Mamidala Jagadesh Kumar.

While HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal 'Nishank' said he is "distressed" over the involvement of JNU students in the violence as pointed out by the Delhi Police. The Congress alleged that the Delhi Police is clearly influenced by the Government, the Home Minister and it demanded the removal of the city police chief and the Vice Chancellor. HRD Secretary Amit Khare who met both the sides on Friday — administration led by JNU V-C and JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh — said JNU has agreed to basic demand of students and thus they are requested to call off agitation.

The emergency meeting was called to discuss the situation on campus and resolve the standoff between the students and the administration. Students also sought the HRD Ministry's intervention in FIRs and proctorial inquiry initiated against them by varsity administration.

Khare also directed the UGC after JNU wrote to UGC to meet the utility and service charges. After the meeting Jagadesh Kumar said all decisions taken earlier at the HRD Ministry about the hostel fee are being implemented "in totality" and regular classes at the varsity will start from January 13.

Aishe said the JNUSU stood on its demand for the removal of V-C, but any decision on whether to call off the agitation against the fee hike will be taken later. Nishank through social media said the Ministry will not tolerate any violence and anarchy on the campus as it is committed to ensuring academic atmosphere in educational institutions. "Distressed over involvement of JNU students in violence as pointed out in Delhi Police's preliminary probe. This is unfortunate," he said in a series of tweets.

Title: 3 Profs move HC, ask for saving CCTV footage, evidence
Article:
nThe day Delhi Police claimed to have identified 9 accused people involved in last Sunday's violence inside Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), three JNU professors approached the Delhi High Court seeking directions to preserve data, CCTV footage and other evidence relating to the January 5 violence on the varsity campus.

The petition, filed by Ameet Parameswaran, Atul Sood and Shukla Vinayak Sawant, seeks necessary directions to the Delhi Police Commissioner and Delhi government. The petition has been listed for hearing before Justice Brijesh Sethi on January 13.Filed through advocates Abhik Chimni, Maanav Kumar and Roshni Naamboodiry, it sought a direction to the Delhi Police to retrieve all CCTV footage of JNU campus.

The petitioners also sought directions for preservation and retrieval of all material/ evidences available with WhatsApp INC, Google INC and Apple INC pertaining to relevant data of WhatsApp groups 'Unity Against Left' and 'Friends of RSS' including messages, pictures, videos and phone numbers of the members, in connection with the violence at JNU. The plea said the petitioners apprehend that in the absence of a direction from the court or the police commissioner, the relevant evidence may not be properly preserved.

It claimed that as per the knowledge of the petitioners as well as news reports, the police has not yet retrieved CCTV footage, which is crucial evidence.

The plea claimed it was evident that a significant amount of data, information, evidence and material pertaining to the said incident of violence, including persons with their registered phone numbers responsible for the same, was communicated through WhatsApp's platform, and its data back-up is an important evidence in respect of the incidents of violence.

"In order to ensure that the relevant evidence may be preserved, JNU teachers association (JNUTA) has sent requests/ representations to respondent nos. 1 (Police Commissioner), 3 (WhatsApp) and 4 (Google), asking that all these materials be safely retrieved for investigation purposes.

"In these representations, JNUTA has cited relevant provisions of the respondent no.3's Terms of Use, Information Technology Act, 2000, Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines) Rules 2011 and other applicable laws. The petitioner no.2 has also sent similar request/representation to the respondent no.3," the plea said.

However, the police has neither responded to such requests placed by one of the petitioners and JNUTA nor has it reached out to them, or other informants, despite clear and cogent material provided to the investigating agency along with the written representations, it claimed.

It may be noted that on January 5, a mob of masked men stormed the campus and targeted students in three hostels, unleashing mayhem with sticks, stones and iron rods by hitting inmates and breaking windows, furniture and personal belongings. Three FIRs were been registered at Vasant Kunj (north) police station in the incident.

Title: Regular classes to start from Jan 13, says V-C after meeting MHRD
Article:
nJawaharlal Nehru University Vice Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar on Friday said all decisions taken earlier at the HRD Ministry about the hostel fee are being implemented in totality and regular classes at the university will start from January 13.

The university administration will extend the deadline for the semester registration process again if needed, he said after the HRD Ministry met with a five-member team from the JNU administration, including Kumar.

The emergency meeting was called to discuss the situation on campus and resolve the standoff between the students and the administration.
